description:
This place is beyond awesome the service incredible.. 
food is on point..
Next time I'm back in San Francisco this is my place..
I can taste it all the way here from Long Beach lol
author: JD W.

description:
This is by far my favorite place to eat breakfast in SF. The ambiance is low key and welcoming with a radio quietly playing in the back, and friendly staff immediately making you feel at home.

The food is consistently good. One thing that stands out to me is that without exception, the avocados are always perfectly ripe. 

The fresh seasonal fruit is cut individually per order, seconds before being served, a rare treat at any restaurant.

If you come here more than a few times wearing a smile , you'll probably be welcomed by name after not too long. Chatting with a fellow customer or one of the staff often turns into a lively conversation between many people. That being said, if you prefer  to eat and read in peace for a little while, the gentle background noise is exceptionally calming, and no one will bother you. Probably not a great place for laptop use however.

In summary, come here for consistent, simple delicious American breakfast food and a great small diner vibe!
author: Isaac G.

description:
Hungry and ready to start the day, we found New Taraval Cafe as one of the better places to eat breakfast, so we came here! 

7:51AM on a Wednesday morning, and fortunately for us, there were only about 4 other customers there. I had read one previous review saying this place is full even at 7:16AM, so I was relieved when we had multiple tables to choose from. We ended up picking the Breakfast Special and the New Taraval Special. 

Something great about the Breakfast Special was that it's only $6 because we came earlier than 9AM! I was going to order just the pancakes, but then I realized I could get eggs and sausage with my pancakes for the same price! The sausage was savory and not too oily, which was great for my still aching stomach! The eggs were fresh/thankfully not powdered, unlike in some restaurants. The pancakes were light, airy, and definitely filling! 

The New Taraval Special is just like the Breakfast Special, but with French Toast instead. The French Toast was extra fluffy and soft! I'm glad it didn't taste too egg-y, like some French Toast can taste if dipped into the egg batter for too long. This entree was so huge, we ended up saving a third of it and taking it home! 

This place is CASH ONLY, so make sure to bring some cash!! New Taraval Cafe has some quality food for a cheap price - we ended up spending $20 for the food plus tip for the two of us! This place is worth your time and money!
author: Liselle L.

description:
I am thrilled when I find a mom and pop place that's really good. New Taraval is small so there is usually a short wait, but you can get breakfast for two, served hot and delicious for under $20 including tip. Come before 9am and there's a breakfast special for $7!

In SAN FRANCISCO that's a find.

French toast is great. Omelettes  are huge and very tasty. Breakfast special is prepared very well:  bacon or sausage, eggs and fluffy pancakes.  They use Fresh ingredients. There are Friendly servers. It's an Iconic little place.

My only suggestion would be to wash down the walls and the doors to clean it up and also to clean up the bathroom!  I promise it won't take anything away from the charm if the walls, doors and bathroom are clean!!!
author: Jane K.

description: Went here for the first time with my fiancé and my two children. I absolutely LOVED the Irish breakfast!! Will definitely be going back soon.
author: Chloé M.

description:
You know its good when 16 people are here at 0710, doesnt anyone sleep in or the SF living disease, get here before it gets crowded.

Only one table left in the back better hurry.
author: Kevin L.

description:
My daughter says five stars or nothing! This place offers a great, classic diner experience at super reasonable prices, friendly staff, and good food. It's everything you want in a comfort food experience. 

Did not try it, but kudos for the full fry under $15. My daughter isn't ready for black or white pudding yet, but maybe if there's a next time!
author: Jubal L.

description:
A small local business that's quiet, yet busy with regulars. The menu is not large, but has the standard breakfast stuff & some lunch items. Staff is nice, but not super attentive, but will get whatever when you do ask.

I ordered the New Taraval Special, which is two eggs, 2 bacon/sausage, & 3 slices of french toast. Overall, it was pretty good, but the bacon was a bit tough to bite/chew, but isn't a major issue. But otherwise, everything else was cooked fine.
author: Spencer H.

description:
Great place for quick inexpensive breakfast. They have a deal BEFORE 9am if you order their special it's two eggs, bacon or sausage, two pancakes or toast for $7. Coffee is good, breakfast was fresh and crispy, i wish more places got it right like they do, simple quick eats and polite service. The staff was all in a good mood, laughing and joking, great vibe. After 10am on Sunday this place had a line out the door. It's small so a party of 4 needs to show up early if you want to be seated quick, but the bar seating is so comfy, they are low super cushy bar stools.  I was dining alone so I went with that, and got to sit right away. 
CASH ONLY. 
I will be back to this place for sure. Great experience and doesn't hurt the wallet!
author: Mona L.

description: This place is bomb. Cheap, good breakfast and fast service! $7 breakfast special. The food was delicious and fresh way bette than McDonald's breakfast and almost the same proce
author: Johny B.

description:
Was in the area and was craving brunch. Wifey found this place for us...

I ordered the Irish Breakfast and was pleasantly surprised. Shortly after our meals arrived on our 4 top, Steven (one of the waitstaff) came by to check on us--and he gave us a run down on what I was eating and the 2 most popular ways to eat the breakfast--as a sandwich and all mixed up.

I liked playing with every element from blood and white sausage daubed in gooey egg yolk from my over-easy eggs, delicately spiced links with egg white and sourdough toast, chased with tender bacon... it was so perfectly balanced!

Unpretentious dining room and prices. High throughput and efficiency. I love the vibe here!
author: Lu-Shien T.

description:
I like this place. But would never go back on a Sunday, nooooo way! The place was super crowded and it took almost 35min for a party of two to be seated. 

We were sat in there very back where it's next to rotting fruit on a stand that had cobwebs on it and a few feet from the bathroom (which was pretty gross btw). 

The food is good but not super amazing or anything. It is filling and well priced. Cash only is kind of annoying. I don't get small businesses that do this cash only thing since most people do not carry much if any cash on them. 

Lunch looked good from what I saw, I always had breakfast. Eggs were a bit undercooked but acceptable. Bacon is tasty but super thin. Coffee cups that are not level - odd. LOL. 

Overall 3 stars. It's a dive breakfast spot that also serves up lunch. I would go there again, just not on the weekend - ever.
author: Bella B.

description:
A+ solid diner food. Table has all the seasonings you need to make it to your preferred spice level- even three types of hot sauce. 

My husband ordered the Irish breakfast and cleaned the plate. I ordered the veggie scramble. The eggs were cooked perfectly- taken off before completely done and left to cook themselves. The scramble was over half vegetables so I didn't feel as much guilt as I should eating as much as I did.

There was so much food that our next meal was small and right before we went to sleep.
author: Liz V.

description:
We went here only because one of our favorite cafes Rolling Out was closed for Labor Day weekend. Two nice ladies outside of Rolling Out were looking for a place to have breakfast, too, since Rolling Out was closed. They did the research for us (hehe) and told us about New Taraval Cafe up the street. Sooo glad they told us about this place. 

We had the breakfast special ($5 before 10am) with a side of home fries and the corned beef hash with two eggs ($8) with some fruit. We had some coffee, too. And it all cost $18.50 (before tip)!!!! Everything was sooo good. The staff was also very nice and friendly. They made sure my mug was filled with coffee. ;)

I was also watching the cook and his helper. They're super efficient. They were really nice, too. 

Interestingly enough, those two ladies who told about us this place were not there. Were they just a figment of our imagination??? LOL. Thank you, angels of New Taraval Cafe.
author: Dee F.

description:
Great place in the Sunset for breakfast.  Great service and great prices!!  3 greats are better than one!!  It's clean too.  

Does fall under the greasy spoon category due to basic decor and age of the restaurant, but food is always fresh and cooked well.  Very consistent at cranking out solid meals e.g. Eggs any style, sausage, bacon home style potatoes pancakes etc...time after time.  I have never had a bad meal.  Plus.... Really Good size portions that get me through lunch.  Staff is super friendly but never overbearing. 

SF peeps should continue to support these family run establishments in this era of skyrocketing rents.  I know that I will.

Peace
author: Edmond S.

description:
Simple and easy. The servers there are super friendly and the food was in big portions! For the price compared to all the other bougie breakfast spots SF has, this place just feels nice and comfy. The feeling where you don't have to wake up, look extra cute with your makeup on, and fit in with the other Instagram addicted crowds. 
No no.. I can just wake up and roll out of bed and walk out in PJs with morning breath. (Haha jk about the morning breath- brush your teeth people!!) 
But yeah, cozy. Feels like I can just get my breakfast groove on and start my day.
author: Anne C.

description: Hard to imagine a better, easier, cheaper breakfast experience in SF. They seated our large party, everyone found something they liked, the price was right and we had more food than we could eat. Kid-friendly, too.
author: Carl B.

description: A full breakfast for $7??? Pancakes or toast, eggs, bacon or sausage. Quite a deal.
author: Jessi C.

description: Good food, great service, but be prepared to wait around 30 minutes for a table! I'd recommend the avocado bacon burger (but ask for one level more rare than you'd like, it comes out a bit over cooked)
author: Jake B.

description:
Best breakfasts and burgers!
$1 to add scrumptious fruit to Joe's Special scramble.
author: Geri S.

description:
Here is an overdue review for this homey brunch spot.

I came here for the second time on a weekday around noon. I was greeted right away and seated at the bar. First thing that caught me eye was their cute Chicken & Waffles cartoon up on the wall! 

I ordered the Country Scramble (comes with your choice of toast and potatoes/fruit) and an orange juice (they use Simply's Orange Juice!).

Maybe I was hungry but the food really hit the spot: perfect temperature, bare minimum seasoning (I guess you can always add seasoning to your taste).

The staff was very friendly and attentive, they checked in on me once in a while (asking if I'm okay when I'm just spacing off.. lol).

Definitely worth giving this place a shot if you're craving for brunch and like reasonably priced OJ ($2.50 for a full glass).
author: Amy T.

description:
My cousin and his girlfriend always ended up here whenever they'd ditch. She picked the place and we met for a late lunch. And although it's nothing fancy as I've been forewarned I do like this place.

I got the Joe's special (an egg thing).

It wasn't savory, but it wasn't straight up bland either. I can't describe it.  

Something about it makes me prefer that dish over other breakfast places: not greasy, and easy to customize with salt/pepper or whatever needed. I think I've been more conscious of what I eat because my cholesterol is borderline high so I think this is a great option.

All I added was ketchup. Usually I don't add anything, but it did need that oomph from me and it was just perfect. And I liked the spinach in this dish..

But, oh my gosh.. too much bread comes with this dish. I was stuffed.. I definitely like the proportions here.
author: Lilian L.

description: My Dad and I come here often. We both love the food and the staff cause its like, family owned and stuff
author: Nino A.

description: Service and Food were on point! Found this breakfast joint through yelp. Loved that it was a small mom & pop shop. As soon as we arrived we were greeted and asked to sign up on this notepad. Steven assisted us, he was extremely personable and down to earth! Food came within 5 minutes and EVERYTHING was perfect! Presentation and Taste, AMAZING!!!! Thank you!
author: Alfredo F.

description: Great little spot.... get a feel of old school cafe. The food and prices are really good. Highly recommend the pork chop plate for only ten dollars. We'll definitely be back
author: Ivan C.

description: Amazing coffee and breakfast options, Can't beat the price. It is a typical San Francisco breakfast place you can go to and enjoy a tasty coffee in the morning. Great staff
author: Julio S.

description: Quick, cheap, greasy-spoon, short-order style breakfast in a small joint with what looked like a lot of regulars.  Exactly what we were looking for.
author: Justin W.

description:
Work up the street and if your not Asian... you get a little sick of the choses available on taraval. However I walked pass this place before and made a mental note to have a try. 

There was a nice amount of people in the place and the individual diner like seats were all taken. I was looking forward to the grill cheese but knew it would probably be American cheese which doesn't get me excited for a grill cheese. I was in question about the side because I could've just ordered the fries however. I've been wanting potato salad recent and it was one of the options. When my waiter came up he let me know what was in it and some other stuff that I didn't hear because I zoned out. He left and soon brought me back a sample size (nice size) of potato salad which was very nice considering. 

When my food finally arrived my grilled cheese could've been melted more. But there was plenty of avocado to over shadow that. I would just say... try and change the cheese to cheddar or Monterey Jack for some gooey stringyness. I'm sure everyone would love. And maybe grill in some butter for the added creaminess. All and all not a bad meal.
author: Jasmin J.

description: Went for breakfast on a Saturday. There was a line, so I wrote my name on the tablet in the counter. Place is usually busy and has a line. But it's worth the wait!!  We had the Breakfast Special- 2 eggs, bacon or sausage, pancakes. We split an order of Home fries. Food came quickly and was hit and fresh. The pancakes were huge and so fluffy!  Bacon was crispy and Sausage and our eggs were done to perfection and how we ordered them. Glad we ate here and we will be back. Reasonable prices, generous portions and friendly service. A must try.
author: Elizabeth O.

description: The prices are great. The food is simple and fresh! The staff are always nice. Parking near by is not too bad at all.
author: Jaxxxie P.

description:
I was searching for a place that just had some good breakfast and this place showed up. Some of the best breakfast I've had in SF. I ordered the pork chops and eggs and it was some of the most flavorful chops I have ever had. The juices mixed with my over-easy eggs and potatoes (Sorry not sorry for the details) You can also get a side of fruit to substitute WHICH I noticed that was freshly cut and not pre made. I thought that was cool.
Their coffee tastes great and not burned at all. 

Thanks for the great breakfast experience! Will be going back there when I drive back up.
author: Diego A.

description:
This is my favorite breakfast spot in the city if you want a diner experience. Great food and service. I like to sit at the bar and watch them cook. It's pretty small and there's usually a small line formed, but it moves quickly.

I love how simple and clean the menu looks. They have a lot of great options that I don't see everywhere. The bacon, avocado omelette and BLAT (a BLT with avocado) are some of my fave orders. If you like avocado, then you'll like this place. All of the ingredients are freshly prepared, which makes it unique from other diners. You can even see them cutting the fruit as they plate it.

The potatoes are delicious and thick. Not your usual stringy hash browns. And the servers are friendly and chill. I like the overall vibe of this place. It feels like you're sitting in someone's kitchen or home.

The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because its cash only! Its not super convenient for me as I never have any cash on me. :/
author: Sara S.

description: What a nice find for breakfast on the way to the SF zoo! We were greeted by the very warm and friendly wait staff and seated quickly. We got the California scramble with avocado, bacon, tomatoes, mushrooms and LOTS OF CHEESE (delicious!) and the special with French toast, and a side of corned beef hash. Everything was so tasty and satisfying, and the best part was the quality of the fruit - all hand sliced fresh quality fruit (oranges, blackberries, grapes, strawberries, apple, pears), not the usual tired old melons with like two grapes. Coffee wasn't the best but at least wasn't over-steeped. Altogether a wonderful way to start the day! Will definitely be back!
author: Stephanie L.

description: A friend took me here for breakfast the other; great little diner with quick service. Food was well priced, big portions, and the fruit option had a lot of fresh fruit.
author: Kevin N.

description: This cute little corner cafe serves up a filling breakfast at an exceptional price. The family style atmosphere and full stomach you leave is hard to come across these days. I ordered the corned beef hash and I'm very picky in my eggs. I enjoy fried crispy egg whites and this place NAILED it! Can't wait to come back for more!
author: Peaches H.

description: It's my first time in SF and i just yelp'd breakfast spots near me and this place popped up. Definitely deserves 5 stars and more! The food was delicious, a must eat when in town
author: Ingrid G.

description: The food is pretty solid. I like it well enough. I had the pancakes and bacon and eggs. I also had OJ. Everything tasted great. It was a really cheap meal, less than 10 bucks out the door. I am very satisfied with the price. If I lived in the area I would go again.
author: Jane T.

description:
We are talking late 1960's memories here.  5 stars for a divey, loud, frenetic, friendly, "flavor of old SF" experience and excellent food. 

Small and narrow, with 8 tables on the left, a 6-seater counter on the right, and an impossibly tight coffin of a kitchen, it rumbles and shakes like a mini earthquake each time the Taravel street car passes by.  As for the surrounding neighborhood, what used to be post war, white middle class is now ethnically eclectic, but predominately Asian.  Times have changed, but the essence of this little diner has not.

The menu, predictable.  But the kitchen, as tiny as it was, puts out some outstandingly good food.  

The Hereford brand corned beef (one of only two brands I will accept from a can, btw) was elevated a notch by adding their own delicious potatoes, onion and a little more seasoning.  It became their own "recipe" and it was very good. 

The Joe's Scramble was perfect.  Why is it so hard for other cafes get it right?  This one was well seasoned, using generous amounts of good tasting beef, resulting in excellent flavor.

Want fruit instead of breakfast potato?  It may cost $1 to upgrade, but there is no denying, this fruit is fresh.  And the variety that goes into each serving is mind-boggling.  Freshly sliced pineapple, mango, grapes, pear, apple, orange, grapefruit, banana.

My coffee cup was the vessel for Farmer Bros coffee.  While not my favorite, it was not as weak as I remember.  I cannot complain as it was always a few sip away from being full.

The toast was slathered in real butter, thank you very much.  

With super-sized portions and low prices, this wins an medal for cheap but good eats.  Just remember to bring cash.  And you better learn to parallel park on a hill because my intuition tells me you will not get parking in front.

I hope there is another SF visit in my future so I can eat here "next time".
author: Wendy B.

description: Very good! Service was good and the food was great! The fruit that came with the scramble was so good! Walking distance is why we went but loved this little place. Very dirty inside and it is CASH ONLY so not giving 5 stars
author: Callie D.

description:
New Taraval Cafe is a local, family-owned, small restaurant that offers good, inexpensive breakfast...and they have been doing it for decades. They really deserve 5 stars for their hard work, service, and dedication, but the quality of food is only good, not outstanding. What makes this place packed are their excellent prices and the friendly and familiar staff that provides a "Cheers"-like feeling of knowing people that work and dine there. 

One of their most popular items is the breakfast special. 2 eggs, 2 bacon or sausage, 2 pancakes or toast...for only $4.50 before 10am or $5 after 10am. Add home fried potatoes for $1.50. The eggs were cooked perfect, bacon tasted good, plus the pancakes were a pretty good size! It's a great deal for a great breakfast. The home fried potatoes had a nice crispy texture on the outside, but it didn't have any flavor. I guess that's ok because the salt and pepper shakers (and a variety of condiments and hot sauces) were at the table. 

This place was packed on a Saturday morning. There was a short wait for a table, but our orders took awhile to come out. Service was very friendly and attentive otherwise. Coffee is $1.75 and comes with plenty of refilling. The last time I dined here was probably 20 years ago. Back then, this place was known for a good breakfast for a good price, with friendly staff...and it still is decades later. It's a winner for all neighborhood residents for all ages.
author: Jean S.

description:
I use to live in San Francisco right down the street from New Taraval Cafe (was just Taraval Cafe years ago..I know showing my age) and my buddies and I use to come here Sat. mornings just for the Irish breakfast!!! Wow how I miss that! 

Well had to work on a Sun. morning and was a little early, so decided to see how much different this place has changed and how well they are doing, place was busy and it was 08:30!!  Not much has changed and the food is still really tasty, hot, and a damn good portion for the price!!! 

If you are looking for a good little family joint to have a hot tasty breakfast, this is the place!!!
author: Gil Z.

description:
This was my go to breakfast spot when I lived in the sunset! Me and my boyfriend came here so often, we became regulars! We know all the staff by name, as well as they know our names. We even converse quite often during meals. 

Everyone is very hospitable! The food is great! Very comforting breakfast food. incredible prices, compared to the rest of sf lol. I always recommend this spot to anyone I can, looking for a inexpensive breakfast experience. Their coffee is surprisingly great too. Definitely better than your average diner spot or local denny's. 

One of my favorite parts about this place is they serve RICE. I eat rice with almost  everything! Every time I go in they straight up tell me if they have rice or not, I think it's hilarious. They do run out of it pretty quick, so definitely try to go in early!
author: Grace A.

description:
Wow I ate there this morning and it was sooooo good and cheap! It's cash only tho!! I like that you can watch them cook your food. Everything that was being made looked delicious. I got spinach and cheese omelette with avocado. It was so satisfying I ate it all along with the vey fresh fruit that came with it ( or you could get potatoes). 

The service was nice and they kept the coffee coming. Would go here again! It's a small place though so I wouldn't recommend coming with a big group.
author: Talia S.

description: Small personal Mom and pop shop with some amazing food and great customer service. French toast was yummy! Daily brisket special was quite delicious as well. Love the potatoes
author: Michelle H.

description: While the food was good, the prices posted on yelp is incorrect not even close shall I say. That's why they get 3 stars
author: Koby G.

description:
WOW. Fast, friendly service, inexpensive decent scrumptious food, and pretty (decently) clean inside the diner. The portions, the quality and quantity of the food is just spectacular. 
I would LOVE to go here more often, I can not believe i had been missing out for so long.
author: Stacey M.

description: Had the steak and eggs.  Steak was cooked perfectly.  Food came out in a timely manner.  Only accepts cash.  Haven't been to a cash spot like that in awhile.  Would I go back?  Yes if I'm in the area
author: A T.

description: I love diners and I love this place. I go most weekends with my bestie, and it never fails us. Sometimes a wait, but it's worth it.  Bring cash! Tip your servers extra bc they are always so nice!! The food is great and service is always prompt. Eat pancakes and be happy.
author: Rachel B.

description: Great little local spot. Food is simple, but cheap in price, well done and delicious. No frills but the basics are all very good. The service is fast and nice. Taraval special is $5 before 10AM. Can't beat that! Cash only.
author: Sam A.

description:
Ok ... when you are in the restaurant business , you can't just take days off 
When you feel like it . If there is an emergency , death in family etc , then yes 
. But , the " Hey , we're all young here and we decided to chill" isn't gonna cut it . 
Love this place . Driving from San Mateo 
To see them closed burns me up . 
     The food and prices here are 
Excellent .
author: Mike D.

description: Write your name on the pad of paper near the entrance.  Breakfast is always on point here.  The fresh cut fruit shows their attention to quality.
author: Roger E.

description: Never fail. Best pork chop n pancake in the world. Great food and service. It should be one of place to eat when you are in SF.
author: lina w.

description: This place is average for breakfast. The cafe is small, so if you come around busy hour there will be some waiting time. I came here on a Sunday afternoon waited about 30 minutes for a party for three. The foods is decent and price is fair. I wound recommend this place if you live in the neighborhood.
author: Trong T.

description: I've been going here since I was a kid and it hasn't changed one bit! They have made me the same amazing corned beef hash and eggs every Saturday for the last 15+ years for under 10 bucks. I can't say enough about how much I love this place. Highly recommend it, even if it makes the line longer for me =(
author: Brandon I.

description: This place does not have the best breakfast in SF. However, it is the best value to quality in my opinion. It costs 50% cheaper than other brunch places. The other brunch places definitely do not taste twice as good. This is a hidden gem.
author: Martin N.

description: Great corner spot on Taraval. Breakfast was quick, big and good. Had the Monterey omelette with home fries along with a slice of Texas French toast. The omelette was filled with veggies and avocado the home fries soft in the middle with a nice brown crunch. The toast was so good perfectly made with a dollop of butter and sprinkled with powder sugar. The wait staff are super friendly and keep the coffee flowing. Highly recommend this spot.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Bad service. They didn't get my order right and on time. My friends got their food first and finished and I still didn't get my order. Also I ordered a chicken sandwich with cheese and they didn't put the cheese on top. When I told the waitress I told her not to charge me but she said "no, I have to get it" so she put a cold square of cheese on a plate and handed it for me. The slice of cheese is $1. My friends also asked for pickles multiple times because she kept forgetting.The food isn't worth it.
author: Eileen Joy P.

description:
Cash only!!

Stopped by for the first time this weekend, and I enjoyed the food. It definitely has that small, casual diner atmosphere. There are a few booths, several small tables, and several bar seats. It seems to fill up quickly on weekends, as I waited in line for roughly 15 minutes before being seated, so definitely put your name on the sign-in sheet right by the door. 

After being seated, we waited another 20-25 minutes before getting our food. Given that this is a small place, it seemed like a long wait, but there is only one cook (and the flat top grill is right near the entrance so you can watch him as he cooks.) I wish the process could be somehow streamlined so that they could get orders out more quickly, but as it is, I would just recommend not coming here if you're in a rush. 

On to the food - we ordered the country scramble and the steak and eggs, both with potatoes. The food is simple and hearty, and portions are very filling so you definitely get your money's worth. Overall our dishes were both well done, but if I had one gripe I would say I think the potatoes could be improved with more salt. They're pretty bland. However, I LOVE the crustiness they achieve, so I'm more than willing to season them myself (salt, pepper, hot sauce, sriracha, etc. are all available at each table and at the bar.) 

Anyway, this is a very solid neighborhood joint, perfect for when a greasy breakfast craving hits (or sweet - their pancakes and french toast looked pretty good too!) I'll be back :)
author: Delia Z.

description: Food safety score of 94, not bad for a seemingly hole in the wall place like this.  We've never seen a table cleaned a thoroughly as the Taraval café staff. This has become our new favorite breakfast place in the outer sunset. Family owned, the man on the grill was co-owner and his parents owned the place decades before.  Support local business.
author: Patrick C.

description:
Honestly, it's just what I expected. Basic food at reasonable prices. So I feel kinda bad only giving it 3-stars because I think they actually did exactly what they are trying to do. But, as Yelp says: it's "A-ok" and that is what 3 stars is for. Unfortunately we live in a world of crazy high expectations....

As I said, basic food. Good size portions. 

Extremely reasonable prices. I know that in other parts of the country prices like these are normal, but when you see it in San Francisco, it takes you off guard. $15 for two breakfasts and one coffee. I tipped 33%, because, why not? They are cash only so come prepared. 

Very friendly staff. Small place with a neighborhood feel. 

Would I come back? If I feel like having some one make my eggs and toast for me? Why not. With visitors? Not so much.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Came here for breakfast. Did the breakfast special 2eggs, your choice or sausage or bacon, toast or pancakes. All for the fine piece of $5 before 10!!!! Best deal ever! 

So of course over easy with sausage and pancakes. All of it was cooked to perfection. We had a wonderful breakfast for three for $25!  

Thanks will for the neighbor hood spot. Total gem!
author: Cassandra S.

description: An adorable little breakfast/lunch place! The people who work here are so incredibly friendly and the eggs and hash browns were amazing. Seriously, I don't know why but their hash browns are SO good. The pancakes were okay, not the best but still overall a great place to get some cheap food breakfast! :)
author: Heather B.

description: Simple, fresh, straightforward breakfast fare. Cash only, but very affordable. Early morning hours are a bonus for those who wake early. Love eating here!
author: A H.

description:
Great for a quick no frills breakfast. 
I had the Special with 2 eggs, 2 sausages, 2 pancakes. $4.50
Everything was cook perfectly and got there quick.
Basically, this is a no frills 50's style neighborhood spot.  
Go big n get the Hash or Irish sausage. 
The staff is friendly and competent as they come
author: Craig B.

description: Ive eaten here before and it was good fast food. As I was going to come visit today, while we were waiting for our table, I notice that the cook literally touches all the ingredients and touches the cooked bacon and the plates then touch the cooking appliances and the DIRTY OVER USED TOWEL they use to wipe the dirt off the kitchen tables/stove. My boyfriend and I left so quick after seeing that. Pretty nasty! Yuck.
author: Jojo P.

description: It's a cute and homey little cafe. Food and service were both excellent! The staff was very friendly and the food exquisite.
author: Matt K.

description: Affordable and quick spot for breakfast.  Came in on Jan 2nd.  Was in and out in 25 mins.  Food from scratch was ready in 10 - 15 mins.  Recommend for your greasy spoon dinner fans.
author: T. E.

description:
Came in for breakfast and it was a smart choice!

There were only 5 people here when I walked in and I was helped right upon entrance.

I found a spot to sit and placed my order promptly. This was my first time at this cafe and was glad that I found it. I normally would've gone to the Tennessee Grill that is a block down but it can get packed in there. At this place I could stretch out my legs and relax. That is how I like it.

The crew that worked the morning that I came in were cool! The cook was super cool. He seemed to know everything about the operations of the cafe. I think he is the owner but not too sure. While I was waiting for my food I could smell the food, it was so good. When I was finally served my plate I was ready.

The food was GREAT! Well cooked and the right about of meat and vegetables. 

Oh, this is a CASH ONLY business so keep that in mind. There is a sign behind the counter below the clock. 

#goodstuff
author: Robert F.

description: Cash only. Don't miss that part. Really good breakfast fare and very reasonable prices. Free refills on coffee. Large food portions. French toast is made on site and very good. Table mates had scrambles and said they were good too. All came  with fresh fruit sides.
author: Brian F.

description:
I am updating this review after my 2nd visit here.
Why?  Because this place gives you good food at a great price and the staff (owners I think?) are so fun and friendly.  Talk to them... it will make your day.
Order the fruit as a side item, it is amazing.  They cut fresh fruit right then and there and server it all in a very artful manner on your plate.  Pineapple, apples, pears, grapes, yum!
Understand that this is a small little, hole in the wall kind of diner... not 4 Seasons.
Know that and you will agree it is worth 5 stars.
author: Joe T.

description: My family and I had breakfast here while on vacation. The food was delicious. It is difficult to please everyone in my family of six. However, this place did just that. The customer service was the icing on the cake. They were very kind and accommodating. The place is small and we have a rather large family, but they made it work for us. I highly recommend this place. I know if we vacate in San Francisco again, we will definitely return to the New Taraval Cafe!
author: MonaLisa G.

description: This place is hard to beat for weekend breakfast. We fed our family of 2 adults and 2 children for less than $30.  The Corned Beef Has is Very Tasty and the Fruit Plate is the largest one that I have ever seen.  If you are looking for Lunch items (i.e burgers)-they don't serve them until after 12 pm.
author: John S.

description:
Nothing extravagant but a nice little traditional spot to have a sit down breakfast! The setting is your typical diner. I would see this place to be popular bc of its neighborhood regulars. I got the "New Taraval special" which is French toast, 2 eggs, & 2 pc bacon. I was surprised bc I thought it would be 4 slices of FT but it was 6!

The staff is really friendly too which is always a plus. I would come back again if in the area.
author: Nicole R.

description:
Small hole in the wall type place

Great food for a great price

The fresh Fruit was literally freshly cut right before being brought to the table and there was about 2 cups

Service was very hometown feel and made you feel welcomed
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Wow! Cheapest breakfast place I've ever been to!
French toast, bacon, and 2 eggs $6.50!!! Amazing! Altho the french toast wasn't the best, its pretty good for the price. Orange juice was only $2! 

The guy that served us was nice and polite. Def will be back for cheap, filling food!
author: Debbie D.

description:
5 out of 5 as long as you know what you seek. This place is a DINER, yo. Fast, clean and inexpensive. They deserve a shot because they don't use the excuse of renting in SF to charge $11.00 for a 2-egg breakfast (coughRainTreecough). 

The people here are courteous. Like a breath of fresh air -courteous. Like you feared courtesy was something you had to pay for only to realize that good people treat each other like this for free-courteous. 

Karma points: owner let a grandma from out of town  w grandchild  leave without paying because she was not aware of the cash-only policy. She promised to come back. Owner trusted her. Me too.
author: John K.

description: This place is true to it's hours of operation. A little pricey but worth it. Usually has great customer service and the serve up the meal fairly quickly. Definitely a sit-in place to discuss things. It has a very old timey cafe feel to it.
author: Alex C.

description: After a late night out with friends, I always seem to end up here the next morning. It's a cash only, family owned diner with friendly and quick service. The food is good, the portions are big, and the coffee has free refills so it essentially has everything one needs the morning after a long night out. The prices are extremely fair for the amount of food you get.
author: Christine A.

description:
This is my fave place to go on a weekend morning: it's a little busy most of the time, but it's a cosy little spot to have breakfast with my boyfriend. My favorite is the California scramble, and my boyfriend really likes the corned beef hash. Scratch that: he pretty much just likes everything. The food is pretty good and decently priced, and I like how they don't cheat you on the avocado (other places be like: "we have avocado!" And then proceed to give you one tiny piece.) 

Free coffee refills, yum.

I like how the workers seem to be all working hard and together, and while not overly friendly they're pretty polite, and try to get the food quickly to you.
author: Liliana C.

description: Delicious food for a good price. The staff is really friendly and the environment is very comfortable. Small diner vibe. Much better than overpriced restaurants who are full of themselves. Love this place and will be coming back!
author: Chase H.

description: Great food, typical breakfast menu but done very nicely with good portions, and quality ingredients. Very good service! The best part is that they are extremely reasonable! I highly recommend!
author: alex f.

description:
Great people, good food! Very welcoming 
I come in from San Bruno just for breakfast...
And the price is very reasonable!
author: KariQ A.

description:
Now this is the true definition of a no frills diner. Walked in and was immediately greeted by one of the friendly staff members which was a great way to start my experience here. I knew I was in store for a solid meal as every seat in the place was occupied, mind you this place is tiny and seats a maximum of about 30 people.

There were  a few people ahead of us so we put our name on the list for a table. Before I knew it we were seated and menus were placed in front of us. The prices are more than reasonable, seriously, where are you going to find a breakfast special consisting of 2 eggs your style, 2 pieces of bacon or sausage and your choice of 2 pancakes or toast for $4.50 before 10 am and $5 after? You can't even get a breakfast sandwich at the so called "Golden Arches" for that much. It almost feels like you are getting over on them. But hey, I'm not complaining by any means.

We received our grub and I went ham on my ham and cheese omelette. It was on point, a nice portion and was everything I expected. The other members of the group had the breakfast special and both were full before finishing their plates. We were checked on twice during our meal to ensure everything was up to par and we appreciated that. 

I will definitely be back, there is nothing better than knowing you contributed to a good ol' fashion Mom & Pop's restaurant and with a staff as friendly and appreciative as this one how can you not support them? Kudos New Taraval Cafe, keep up the great work!
author: Josh H.

description:
Great place for breakfast! Inexpensive and great service. Guys are so friendly!
We are coming back.
author: Janes D.

description: Simple, easy, no frills breakfast that's cheap. Perfect for a hangover when your brain can't process words and you just need food.
author: Lauren T.

description:
I ordered the breakfast special with pancakes, eggs over easy, and bacon. The bacon was on the dry side, but the eggs were done perfectly and the pancakes were buttery and fluffy - exactly how they should be! Staff was also very friendly and really trying to make conversation with all their patrons. House coffee is nothing special though. But, all in all, a solid square breakfast.

The restaurant, itself, has the atmosphere of an old style diner which is fun and cozy, but not exactly a place I would take my friends to enjoy a good brunch in the city. The exterior of the restaurant is also less than welcoming in my opinion, comparing it to other places in the city that have similar price points and atmosphere.

$6.80 for breakfast special and coffee.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Amazing breakfast! This little place is great. Fresh fresh food, pancakes super fluffy, eggs well cooked. Try the Joe's scramble its bomb! A++++
author: Joe R.

description: Can't say enough good things about the staff here, welcoming, entertaining conversation, great sense of humor. This has become our neighborhood breakfast spot. If you're an aspiring sriracha artist and enjoy good breakfast at a great price in the Sunset, this is your spot.
author: David G.

description:
Be warned, I have waited up to 20 minutes to be seated, but it has always been worth it out of the 3 times I've been here.

A great mom & pop diner on Taraval. Don't come here if you're looking for a fancy designer brunch with artesian spa water and bloody Marys. This is not that kind of diner. This is a classic, consistent, and valuable member of the diner community with good quality food. I am not a coffee snob, but the understand how to brew a perfectly balanced breakfast blend (pun intended).

Once you're seated you get great service and just the right amount of personal attention. The intimate atmosphere generates a calm, inviting, and friendly place to eat.

This is a cash only establishment, but the prices are hard to beat in San Francisco. I highly recommend.
author: Lo B.

description: Excellent breakfast! We had an omelet and one of the breakfast scrambles. Food is very good and the service was also excellent. Highly recommended!!
author: Jill G.

description:
A popular spot in the Parkside neighborhood. Customer service after you get seated is great and prices are very reasonable. Waiter came by many times to check how you're doing and refills water and coffee pretty frequently. I think the food is okay, not particular good but not bad. Food may take a while to come out because it gets pretty busy! 

A good spot if you want some inexpensive diner food at an old timey diner. I ordered two eggs with toast and choice of house potatoes or fruit for $4.5 while fiancé ordered a three egg scramble with beef and onions that came with toast and choice of house potatoes or fruit for $7.5. Total bill was $13, inexpensive to fill our tummies and for the great customer service experience.
author: Iris H.

description: The place to get a good BF and wont bust your wallet either. I love getting steam rice, spam and eggs for under 7.00.
author: Paulina P.

description:
FOOD: the food is mediocre, you get what you pay for. 2 eggs, 2 sausage, 2 pancakes or toast for 5$ before 10am. The ingredients they use aren't the best, you can see and taste the low quality. They use a slice of cheese on top of omelettes. 
ENVIRONMENT: small restaurant, not really clean, floor is dirty and booths/counter are old. I came in and sat down with my feet on the booth and the asian cook with a beard came and told me to take my feet off the booth...really? This place is going to be strict about shoes touching the booth but doesn't care about how sanitary the restaurant looks... makes no sense. He should have been wearing a hair protecting to keep his beard out of ppls food. Ruined my mood after that absurd request.
SERVICE: not bad, waiters and waitress are attentive only when you come in and take your order, then you're ignored until you ask for the bill.
author: Vicky C.

description:
I will say food is cheap and good. It is a great Mom and Pop place. Apparently, I went to high school with their son, but didn't realize it until later. Very Chinese-influenced diner. I love the fact that you can get rice instead of the usual potatoes (I am Asian still) and I'm not the biggest fan of breakfast food. 

Hate to be blunt since I am for this place, but the food is no frills. It feels like a friend cooked it for me. It was average to be honest. 3 stars. The pancake was burnt, but they comped it. The chicken apple sausage was super greasy and charred. I think they needed to scrape the grill more often. We also wanted to get the New Taraval Special but to sub the sausage with their Chicken Apple Sausage. We asked the waiter and he took a while to calculate off his head what that substitution would cost. Pretty sure it was an arbitrary number ($3), but we were fine with it since everything else is so cheap.

My favorite part was probably the fruit bowl. It was very yummy and worth the extra 50 cents. Now, it's not like what you'd expect (usually berries and/or melon), but I got slices of pear, apple, and grapefruit, and bananas. This reminded me of what my grandma used to do for me back at home. It felt very homey, but also slightly odd at a restaurant diner. It had it's endearing charm.

Pros:
-Seated fast
-Cheap food
-No frills
-Good amount of parking
-Friendly service
-Potatoes were crispy yum.
-Fruit substitution was yummy

Cons:
-No frills
-Average and greasy food
-French toast has no cinnamon (a sin in my book LOL)
-Syrup didn't taste sweet (not sure why)

I would give this 3.5 but round up for yay local support :)
author: Josie W.

description:
Stumbled upon this spot one Sunday morning, I love discovering new mom and pop shops to try! This place had such a home-y feeling. You could tell they had a bunch of regulars too because the workers knew their customers by their first name.

We waited about 30 minutes to get seated. The place was packed! It did take a little while to get our food but you could tell everything was being cooked as ordered. 

I had the pork chops and the boyfriend had one of the breakfast specials with french toast and eggs and sausage. We also ordered corned beef hash on the side. The food was yummy, it reminded me of comfort food. And the prices were very reasonable!
author: Dara S.

description:
I have been here two or three times now with the most recent one being last sunday. While the food here is on the good side (i love their omelettes), i do think the place needs a better front man. The bald asian guy whom I think is the owner was just downright unpleasant to deal with. Also, this is just my observation from my last couple visits here (meaning i can be wrong and jumping to conclusion), but the bald guy will treat white people differently (being nice and all). 
This place is deserving 4 stars but the bald guy is a big no no. 2 stars lost. I'm not returning.

Btw the waiters are nice!!!
author: Agus S.

description: ive been going to this place for years. its the best bang for your buck and the consistency has never gone down. i usually always try to go here on saturdays with my son. the food is great and you cant beat the price for what they serve. the people who work here are very friendly and inviting. if you go early expect to wait at least 30 mins minimum. around noon is usually when the crowds start to die down and there will not be a long wait. for people who are looking for a good breakfast cafe this place is a must try.
author: Art N.

description: They updated the menu. For the breakfast special, it's no longer $4 if you get seated before 10am. The new price is $4.5 before 10am and $5 after 10am. The price is still very competitive.  The server walked around and asked customers if they wanted  refills a few times. The service was attentive.  Add $1.5 for potatoes. Overall, the food was good. I had their omelette before, and it was good was well.
author: Rachael C.

description: From the outside the cafe doesn't look too welcoming but I guarantee that the food is great! I ordered the breakfast special with a side of house potatoes for about $10 including my hot chocolate! Prices are great and the place is busy. Service was good, I stood there awkwardly for about 5 min until my party and I seated ourselves. I didn't like that but other than that great place for your average breakfast!
author: Elizabeth V.

description:
Walked into this place for breakfast, my first impression was that it was small and quite dingy. 

While this itself was not enough to turn me off, a quick check with the staff revealed that they are cash-only. As a rule, I don't do business with "cash-only" establishments because A) It offers them the opportunity to under-report their earnings (and thereby pay little tax on their revenue), and B) it demonstrates a lack of interest in providing this small convenience to its customers.

Any place that is too cheap to take cards as payment is clearly cutting corners... and this makes me wonder what other corners they may be cutting. So yeah... no thanks.
author: M C.

description: Good food, good prices. Our server was nice. Cute little breakfast spot, close by to my place.
author: Lau H.

description: What a gem on Taravel! Everything from the food to the staff are great. This is our favorite breakfast spot in the hood!
author: Jeff M.

description:
One of my favorite breakfast joints in the neighborhood! Small mom and pop owned joint with CHEAP breakfast meals! 

Their breakfast special which consists of 2 eggs, 2 bacon or sausage, and 2 pancakes or toast for about $4.50! You can't beat that price! The people working there are great. Lots of regulars are there daily.

Cash Only!!
author: Daniel S.

description: Food and portions were ok. But wait was way too long. Almost one hour wait for Monday brunch time.
author: Sajan S.

description:
This is a little hole-in-the-wall diner that has super affordable prices, dishes out generous portions, and is incredibly unpretentious. 

The interior is small but cozy, with both booth and table seating. I came here with a friend on a Monday morning, and most of the tables were full. You could tell that many were old customers by the way they greeted the staff. Service was efficient, even though there was only one lady bussing the entire floor. I also appreciated that there were condiments on very table (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/new-taraval-cafe-san-francisco?select=-XaLwPyowXV_the18EeTEA#cIPMXJFD2uguGMd_UGe4uA). 

French toast special with eggs and sausage:
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/new-taraval-cafe-san-francisco?select=-XaLwPyowXV_the18EeTEA#oc67PzUgpO6rbetMk5z6pg)
Because I'm such a sucker for French toast, I had to try it here. The lady also let me know that they had a special to go along with it, even though it wasn't listed on the menu. The eggs were cooked well, with the yolks still runny but whites cooked through. The sausages were mediocre, although I've never really been a fan of breakfast sausages. The French toast was generous in portion, and I really liked the texture, but the flavor was lacking. The coated eggs on both sides were done well, but it lacked any traces of vanilla extract, cinnamon, or nutmeg. I had two slices and used them mostly as toast to mop up the runny yolks of the eggs, but the French toast flavors were definitely lacking. 

Breakfast special with hotcakes, eggs and sausage:
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/new-taraval-cafe-san-francisco?select=-XaLwPyowXV_the18EeTEA#7CEo-3cmnaqIdlyl7ukdrQ)
My friend got the breakfast special with two hotcakes, and I think they were cooked well. They were quite fluffy and didn't leave that kind of sweetened-flour aftertaste in your mouth. The sausages were the same as the ones I had; not bad, but nothing memorable. The eggs were a little strange.. they were very rubbery in texture for some reason, and the whites weren't even cooked all the way through. We were both mystified by how they could be so rubbery, but it wasn't so bad that it was inedible. 

This is a quick, hassle-free little place to stop by for a quick breakfast, but it's not somewhere I would specifically take someone.
author: Maggie X.

description:
This place is great. It is a really small resturant, but I have not experienced any wait time for a table. When I was working around here, I would always come here during my lunch. I love the corned beef hash. I love the bacon. I love the sausage. The portions are large, the service is friendly, and they remember who their return customers are.

They are cash only, but their prices are really low. Especially if you come in early (before 10 am) and get the special for only four bucks! If you need cash, you can find an ATM or go to the Walgreens nearby and get cash back.

This is definitely my go to place for a real, traditional, filling breakfast on a budget.
author: Audrey D.

description: The corned beef hash and eggs are great. They also have some good breakfast specials. This place is easy on the wallet and the people are really friendly. Definitely has that neighborhood diner feel. There's nothing fancy about the place just good home cooked breakfast, great atmosphere, and very reasonable.
author: Travis B.

description:
Awesome!
Found a spot where I can grab a really good breakfast.

I had scrambled eggs with chicken apple sausage, potatoes, & toast. Cooked perfectly, fresh & delicious.
These guys take pride in doing things right. Friendly, positive, old school place.
I will definitely be back.
author: Jonathan P.

description: Great little spot for great cheap breakfast food!  Very friendly servers, food comes out quick and hot.  They keep the coffee filled! Very small establishment but the customers get in and get out.  If you get there before 10am they have a very filling $5 special.  Cash only as well.
author: Tricia M.

description:
A full house in the morning.
Time from seating to ordering: 3mins. (+)1
Time from ordering to arrival of meal: 13 mins on a full morning (+) 1

How did it turn out?
Eggs Scrambled: evenly cooked, none of that liquidy stuff you get from mcdonalds. And it held together after being cut through with a knife and fork. (+)1

BACON!!: it was cooked well enough where it wasnt dried and crispy like jerky but wasnt ice like fish from the deadliesr catch. I was actually impressed by how juicy and easy it was to cut it to pieces to pair with the pancakes.  (+)1

The ones at other breakfest spots make you feel like you're eating deep fried tarantulas. 

Pancakes: Light and fluffy, not flooded with cheap butter or torn apart because of a lazy cook. They did a very good job making it light enough to where to you wont feel bloated after the check is paid. (+)1

And for the portions to pricing as well as your accomodating side combos , you could officially label  IHOP as rip off on its pricing and quality.

OJ: Ice cold and not sour. As good as it gets (+)1

Problems? IF  quicklys wasn't next door, they would have so much more space for seating, their food is better here at New Taraval Cafe anyway.. not over-reaching and not piss poor crap on a plate..

This is how restaraunts should be. Quality over price.
Simple Comfort foods over 'Wth' Menus...

Even Gordon Ramsay would probably be pleased.
author: Eric C.

description: Fresh tasty home-made food.This place is kind of like your average breakfast spot, but the staff here are super friendly and seem like they genuinely love their job.
author: Hannah J.

description: This cafe is a real deal kind of place.  Hidden behind an unassuming facade is a cafe with great food, huge portions and friendly staff!  We ordered the French toast, California scramble, BLT  with egg, yum!, pancakes with bacon, and corned beef with hash browns.   Everything was consumed with gusto.  Make sure you ask for fruit on the side, you will be pleasantly surprised with fruit that could pass for art.  There were people waiting to get in when we arrived, and there were people waiting to get in when we left.   Could be the prices were great, could be the super friendly staff, could be the great food.  It definitely is worth any wait.  The owners are friendly and the staff checked in on us several times.  .  As Arnold said, I'll be back!
author: Janice W.

description:
I was a regular at this place back about 15 years ago, so during a brief visit to San Francisco (I had since moved away), I just HAD to stop in for breakfast.  At first glance, I was disappointed.  Where's Mary?  Where's Stanley or Tony at the grill?  Who are these new people?  Oh my!

Hey!  I was only disappointed for a second.  Yes, there have been some changes, but I think it's for the better.  The same food and prices.  The same great service, and now, Stanley is out front waiting tables (he really does an excellent job of getting your order to you, and ladies or gay men will be further delighted because he is VERY good looking).

Want rice instead of potatoes with your breakfast?  No problem!  Maybe you'd rather have fresh fruit.  Yup.  They do that too, and it is indeed fresh - I watched them cut it up!

EVERY visit to San Francisco will certainly include a stop here, and I urge the locals to enjoy this wonderful neighborhood treasure!
author: Michael F.

description: Decent food at decent price. Staffs were friendly. Good spot for breakfast and brunch since they open till 2p!
author: Ryan H.

description: What a great find via Yelp and the help of others reviews.  I thought food was great and staff friendly and efficient.  A little bit of a wait, but well worth it.  Perfect place for college student on a budget with a healthy appetite.
author: Danny R.

description:
SO CHEAP! I had 2 eggs, 2 sausages, and a bunch of french toast for only $6.50. I was full for almost the rest of the day. Super friendly service. I would come over and over again. 

Cash only!
author: Corinna T.

description: Came here for breakfast and it was a good meal. The space is kinda tight, so a wait is typical--but it goes relatively fast.
author: Karen G.

description: Awesome spot to eat with awesome people who work there. Prices aren't bad for SF which is why I go here. Too bad it's cash only (Only reason not 5 stars). I would stop by more often if they accepted cards, since I hardly carry cash on me. Those suckers stack up on you. Anyways, the breakfast is great. French Toast is my go to meal. Nothing fancy, but its delicious.
author: Ryan G.

description:
Local spot that is less than unassuming when viewed from outside. I view this as a convenient way to keep those not in the know at bay. They seem to do plenty of business as is. 

Staff are way above average, sassy, and have excellent social skills. The cook is a machine with rockstar consistency. This is diner food done properly. And though diner food should not generally garner 5 stars, the service here bumps it up.

The hash is homemade and has that texture you love from the can but with superior flavor: fresh herbs.

The fruit here is ridiculous. Freshly prepared to order and beautiful. You've never been so happy to eat your garnish.

Plenty of metered parking. 

I'll always keep going back.
author: Alex C.

description: Small and cozy diner spot with a basic breakfast menu.  The specials with pancakes and French toast are spot on. Friendly service and bottomless coffee cups.  Nothing more and nothing less.
author: Shelton F.

description: My best friend and I were yelping awesome places to have breakfast and this place popped up and we took an uber to give it a try. It was freakin delicious! I wish I could have breakfast here everyday. Service was great and the breakfast was awesome. I had the egg special and she had the French toast and we ate it all up in no time. Yummy coffee too! A+
author: Brittney F.

description: This place is super yummy, and the staff is so nice.  Very reasonable prices!  Went here on a rainy day and there was a big wait.  The food was worth the wait.
author: Pauline W.

description: I honestly love this place so much, I come in sit at the counter, get piping hot coffee, order and within 5 minutes hot pancakes, eggs, and bacon are in front of me not to mention they are on it with refill after refill of coffee. Oh did I mention my bill is only 7 bucks?!?!? AMAZING!!!!! I will keep coming back probably for the rest of my entire life!
author: Jacob C.

description: I've been coming to this magical hole in a wall since 2001 and though I don't live on the west coast anymore, I always make sure to stop in for brunch when I'm in town. No one makes hash browns quite like they do and the quality has not changed at all in over a decade. Plus it's super cheap! It's a simple, wonderful brunch spot that will always hold a special place in my heart. Hope it never changes!
author: Joan I.

description:
This is a serious hot spot in the taravel area. As far as traditional American breakfast options in the area. You have this and new Tennessee grill down the block.

The difference between these two is actually pretty surprising. The cost of American breakfast around the country has jumped to historic WTF levels.

Grand slams from Dennys starting at 10.99 or similar basics from IHOP at $11-13 starting. 

Absurd! No worries though this place will bring you back to a time where shit is just plain reasonable.

The classic breakfast option is $4.5 before 10am and $5 after. Consisting of eggs, bacon or sausage and pancakes or toast. 

It's $1.5 more for potatoes.

Totalling 6.5 at most for a classic breakfast.


CASH ONLY 

So good option however as others mentioned nothing crazy original or unique. Cash only also bit of a pain in a moderate era.
author: Nathan A.

description: This is a great little spot. Not the fancy shancy place, but the food is tasty and at great prices. Defo will be coming again.
author: Kuks S.

description:
First of all, two fluffy pancakes, two eggs any style, and two pieces of crispy bacon or breakfast sausage for $5. FIVE DOLLARS plus tax.  They have soy sauce, SPAM (what, I'm originally from Hawaii, don't judge me),  and rice instead of hash browns if you ask.  

Tapatio, Crystal, Soy Sauce, AND Siracha on the table.
   
BEAT THAT, BOUGIE BRUNCH PLACES IN THE OUTER SUNSET.  And also BEAT THAT, TENNESSEE GRILL DOWN THE STREET.

Hash browns are not crispy like you'd expect however, so if that's your thing, get the rice or fruit instead.

Second, this is a greasy spoon, which, is, according to Wikipedia,  "a colloquial term for a small, cheap restaurant or diner typically specialising in fried foods."  Now add the local business, same regulars every week, neighborhood joint-style "guys who work here know your name and ask you if you want your usual" descriptors to your typical greasy spoon.  (Seriously, their memory is uncanny) Add all that up, THEN it becomes a neighborhood gem.

I wouldn't wait in line for this place for the food (you can go to the bougie brunch places in the outer sunset for that), but rather for the welcome you get every time you walk in the door. More importantly, you can linger over your newspaper here, and they never rush you.  They get you your check when YOU ask for it, not when they need for you to leave.  

Not many places around that are like that anymore.
author: Iris N.

description: Fast, cheap, and hearty.  Stopped in here for a quick breakfast and ordered the breakfast special,$4.50 before 10am for 2 eggs 2 bacon and 2 pancakes
author: Dan O.

description: Simple, cheap breakfast food. I wouldn't come here with high expectations or more than one other person. The food really just gets the job done, but not much more than that.  Great place for a solo breakfast run though!
author: Isaiah G.

description:
Tiny locals place in San Francisco.  When I went there was a line to get in...and it took about 25 minutes to get inside. 

The menu is nothing to rave about, no special items...or OMG food items.  This is a solid cafe for eggs, pancakes, breakfast meats...etc.  

While waiting in line...watching their cook, prepare orders in the small space he had was hugely entertaining.  It was like watching a juggler in action...and amazing how quickly he was able to prepare so many different things.  

All I can say is the food was good...reasonably priced...actually, for San Francisco...it's actually a good deal...probably one of the cheapest breakfasts I've paid for and left feeling full.  

Great place.
author: Richard J.

description: My wife said to relax after, waiting in line and being oassed over. Then again passed over while the guy  who passed you  gets their food before you!!!!
author: Ivan C.

description: Cheap breakfast, family owned atmosphere, and welcoming workers? Everything I love. I stopped by for some early morning breakfast and this place made my morning. $4.50 for a filling breakfast of 2 eggs, bacon or sausage, and pancake? YES PLEASE. You can tell that the workers here genuinely take their time to give you perfect service! I ordered coffee and the lady that worked here came back to refill my cup 2-3 times without me having to ask for more! The bacon was perfectly crispy and eggs were cooked well sunny side up. I would love to come here again for breakfast!
author: Tiffany H.

description: This was some incredible diner-style food. The service was quick, and my Denver Omelette was exceptional! The chef, Stanley, and staff were very nice.
author: Emmitt W.

description: Open really early and has a good selection. I got the corn beef hash and french toast, which was yummy! I wouldn't recommend the hot chocolate though since its just the swiss miss packets.
author: Larissa L.

description: Can't beat this breakfast spot! Great prices, a lot of food for around 5 dollars. Very friendly crew that works there. Once I started going it became a morning routine!
author: Adam L.

description:
My friend and I drove up from SJ and were looking for a nice place to grab a quick breakfast. We are lucky to say that we found a very friendly diner! All the waiters and waitresses are very friendly. They are very welcoming and helpful if you have a hard time not knowing what foods to choose. 
I ordered The New Taraval Special. I recommend getting the dish if you're interested in filling up on delicious carbs! The French Toast is superb, taking up most of the plate. The eggs were nice and soft and made me want more. Overall, I would definitely recommend people to try this diner.
author: Vivi N.

description:
Solid 4 stars for the super value (4.5 for breakfast plate before 10am), great but not over-bearing service and fluffy pancakes. Be warned, wait can be a bit painful on the weekends (~30 min)

Not your fancy pants SF brunch spot - more like classic diner... and we love it!
author: D L.

description:
I'm surprised I haven't reviewed this place yet. It's two blocks in from 19th Ave and a block from Tennessee Grill. While it has a smaller menu then the aforementioned spot, this place has an awesome Irish breakfast. Their home fried potatoes are tasty. The whole assortment, black and white pudding, bacon, 2 sausage, 2 eggs, potatoes and toast.

The place is a family business with the son taking over for the chef duties once in awhile and the mother is the waitress and more I bet. This place has a great breakfast.
author: Marty J.

description: Excellent breakfast, nice service, and great prices.
author: M W.

description: This hole in the wall is a hidden gem! One of our neighborhood favorites for breakfast/brunch! Friendly service, super cheap (note: cash only) and simple, fresh, delicious food! Family owned and quick service (they're usually packed but they move quickly!) Highly recommend New Taraval Cafe!!
author: Elena A.

description: Just had breakfast and it was fun. Staff personable and friendly, food very tasty. We had a traditional breakfast. We must have arrived at a good time because there were only a couple people ahead of us.  We sat at the counter. Although there was quite a wait for our food, once ordered, it was well worth the wait! Staff recognized that we were visiting and were very engaging. Good sense of humor. Good choice and will visit there again!
author: Vickie O.

description:
Great service and awesome food. Corned beef hash and eggs were cooked perfectly. Loved the home fries. Hubby got the Irish breakfast which was yummy. Lol they said they only cook 4 scoops of rice a day and our group took all scoops. Oops. I highly recommend this place for a yummy and simple breakfast. FYI CASH ONLY

Sorry. Update. I'm a little frustrated. I originally gave the 5 stars and took two back because service was great up until the wait was almost ridiculous. Food took about 30min plus the bill took another 25 min to get. After I asked for it about 4 times. We started to walk out the door to give them the hint we were trying to leave he had a dumbfounded look to why we were still not sitting down. At that point I wanted to complain but considering this is a hole in a wall trying to just do their business and they were busy I left it alone and paid with the tip that I almost didn't want to give. But that would just be wrong considering they were never rude... Just SLOW.
author: Kat G.

description:
We got the New Taraval Special, which is a generous portion of French toast (three Safeway-brand Texas toast slices), two eggs, and choice of bacon or sausage. The food was fine, very simple, a little greasy, nothing we would ever actively desire but could eat again if we had to. It was extremely affordable at $7 for a giant plate. 

The space was ugly on the outside and barren inside. Cash only and bottomless coffee. Servers were all really nice.

We were surprised by the 4-star Yelp rating and long lines, given our very "just okay" experience.
author: Evelyn C.

description:
It was good, like regular homemade breakfast. 

I got the bacon avocado omelette w/ eggs and toast, it was good! My bf on the other hand got the steak, I tried it and it didn't really have much flavor. The mash potatoes didn't really have much flavor either.. Literately had to put pepper and salt on it still wouldn't budge. Maybe steak with teriyaki would've been better but sadly they had run out. 

Service was good tho, nice and always made sure we were doing fine!
author: Sandy L.

description:
This place is amazing!!! The food is great, the price is perfect and people who work there are very nice. It's a small place, but I never had to wait for a table. The are fast and super nice.

The special breakfast is delicious and only $3.50!!!!

I can't stop eating there!
author: Fernanda D.

description: Great mom & pop breakfast spot if you want a simple and CHEAP breakfast!! Got here around 9:45 this morning and it wasn't crowded! Although more people did keep coming in after we got seated. I had the breakfast special which is two eggs any style, 2 strips of bacon (or sausage), and two hotcakes (or toast), for only $3.50 because it was before 10am! After 10am it's $3.95 which is still a really great deal for some simple American breakfast food. They also have a lot of omelettes, and I heard their burgers are really tasty, a good portion size, as well as cheap! Definitely come here if you want something quick and inexpensive!
author: Tara A.

description:
food is damn good, service is friendly and real. Its run by a family of brothers and they all
get along and make sure their customers are happy. It's Diner with a capital D. Prices are
very reasonable. Place is clean
author: Peter F.

description: This place was awesome. It is unpretentious and unassuming. The decor leaves room for improvement, but the place was clean and the food was delicious. I ordered a breakfast sandwich (not on the menu) and got a side of fresh fruit. The sandwich was bomb and the fruit was fresh and spectacular. A huge side with lots of variety: apples, oranges, watermelon, grapefruit, pears, and strawberries. The coffee is what you would expect for diner coffee. The service was excellent and the price was extremely affordable. I got all that for $11 plus tip. I would absolutely come back here next time I'm in SF.
author: Nicole H.

description: Such really good food in the most unsuspecting place. Staff is nice, energetic and always have the most entertaining conversations. It's cash only and it gets pretty crowded during the weekends. I recommend the veggie omelette!
author: Dee D.

description: I am a real sucker for small family owned business ..especially if they are runned with passion by their son/daughter. We were served by Steven who delighted us with his past Yelp! encounters. Service was efficient yet allowing for privacy. Prices are extremely reasonable with great value. YES this is a good one.
author: Dwight S.

description:
Very popular - for good reason. Great service, good solid menu, good prices, and the food is great! We had a superb omelette, Pancakes, Bacon and eggs, - perfect 
We will return.
author: Kae D.

description: This place is bomb! Food is really good And it's not that expensive, great prices! I got spinach and cheese omelet it was really good!
author: Dakota G.

description:
If you want solid down to earth breakfast food this is the place to go. This is not a new hipster San Francisco vegan organic fairtrade breakfast place that serves stuff with brown sugar that was harvested from the hills of Columbia. This is a good-honest ma and pa breakfast place where you can get an omlette, sides, and coffee for $10. 

I recommend this place and anytime I want to get breakfast either by myself or with friends I always make an effort to stop by here at least once a week. The food is fairly priced and the waiters there are nice.
author: Moses L.

description: Great value great service great breakfast food. Usually a wait on the weekends but there's lots of seating at the bar that usually frees up pretty quickly. I always go for one of the breakfast specials, I think I prefer the pancakes over the french toast but it's a close call.
author: Solomon G.

description:
Love this local breakfast place!  Great service and great food.  Great place to get to know your neighbors :-)

We used to go to Tennessee Grill down the block, but their messy service and extra greasy food forced us to find another place.

New Taraval is smaller, but the folks running it are friendlier and the food comes out neat, not messy like TG.
author: Joey B.

description: This place is a gem. I ordered an omelet and pancakes. The omelet tasted homemade with real veggies and other authentic ingredients. The home fries were perfectly prepare, soft and lumpy inside and slightly crunchy on the outside. The pancakes were great better than anything you can find at a chain by far. The only improvements, which I don't think deserves taking a star, is needing better jam or jelly available and syrup, but that could be contributing to the overall rustic taste.
author: Reema E.

description: This is the hole-in-the-wall diner that doesn't look like much, but the food turns out to be amazing. Their breakfast and brunch menu is the best deal in San Francisco. The pancakes are some of the best I've ever had, especially for their price. If you live nearby, this should be your go-to brunch spot.
author: Theresa M.

description: Its a perfect place for a quiet breakfast/brunch. I ordered their veggie omelette which comes with side of potatoes and English muffin. The portions are large and the omelette was really tasty. It is a family owned restaurant and everyone is really nice and friendly. The days I won't feel like making breakfast, this will be the spot I will come to..
author: Kirandeep K.

description:
This is my go to on a weekend morning! Nothing better than the breakfast special for your money. ($4.50 before 10am/$5 after 10am gets you two eggs, two pieces of bacon or sausage, and two pancakes or toast). 

The people waiting outside to get in are a testament to how loyal people are to this place. There is a diner less than a block away but it's nothing compared to New Taraval!
author: Nima J.

description: New Taraval Cafe is not new...and their food NEVER gets old! *pun intended* :P With them being in business for quite some time, I'm sure they have a lot of regulars here when you hear them greet customers coming in by name. This spot serves delicious breakfast all day and lunch items such as burgers and sandwiches. I tried the corned beef hash and it was different than anywhere else I have tried it. It was delicious and nope, none of that canned stuff. Another item on the menu I have to rave about is the french toast! Enough egg soaked in soft toast. You can add your desired amount of cinnamon yourself! I'm excited and looking forward to come back next time for some good breakfast food. Don't walk or drive by this spot without paying them a visit.
author: Nancy N.

description:
Food: 4/5
Price: $
Portion: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Appearance: 2.5/5
Presentation of food: 3/5
OVERALL: 5/5

Came here in need of brunch, it was around 12:45pm on Sunday. For some reason this place reminded me of M's Cafe (the original owned version)! And M's Cafe was my spot to go to without bumping into anyone I know, to just feel 'out of town'.

So when I came here for the first time it was very nostalgic to me, hah, from the prices to the portions and cafe being run by a cute asian family really brought back memories of M's.

I came with the husband, there were a good two party in front of us; the gentleman over the counter made sure he acknowledged us and let us know the approximate wait time (10-15mins) which isn't bad at all for a SUNDAY BRUNCH. So we waited against the wall which has a clear view of the stove top where their dad?, I'm pretty sure it was, and the host's brother on the other half of the grill flipping hash browns and pancakes. I was definitely entertained on how fast they were moving and how smooth everyone (a good 5 of them) flowed in the little area they called a 'kitchen'. BRAVO!
