The show continues when we got seated at their 'bar' area where we now moved the show from the grill to the bar, I love watching them cook and work together; so we also got to view the busser and runner of how they garnish plates and serve drinks so quick!

I ordered their 'house special' which was like $5-$6, came with two pancakes, two eggs (any style), and bacon or sausage. Tasted very similar as well, it was good; pancakes were ultra fluffy and NOT DRY (which is a big plus for me).

I will definitely come back when I'm in need of American style breakfast/lunch again! I am a new loyal client from here on out!


CASH   O N L Y!
author: Eva H.

description: The prices are acceptable! 4 dollars for a special breakfast before 10 o'clock! Includes: two eggs, two sausages, and two toasts. The taste was not bad.
author: Cheukee L.

description:
Mom and pop diner at its best! The prices are dirt cheap and the quality of the food, surprisingly good. I had an avocado BLT which was spot on. No scrimping on the avocado or bacon!

Definitely a keeper and worth a try if you're looking for a quick and simple bite to eat.
author: Ada C.

description: This was a great stop for me, food was fresh,  flavorful and vibrant with color.  Made great conversations with a fellow customer and the server as well.  Very relaxed environment,  portions are just right and the price is more than fair.  The suggestion for the special was on point. Even though it was not St. Patrick's day u can't go wrong with a nice corned beef.  Yum!!!!! I'll be a returning customer for sure.
author: Richard G.

description: Large portions, good service. I love their toast and pancakes!  The eggs and bacon were perfectly cooked also.
author: Kristine P.

description: awesome restaurant my neighbor Liz Barry and I had the most amazing breakfast. The service wonderful very friendly, the prices are beyond very reasonable yummy food. I highly recommend this place.
author: Karen B.

description:
We go there every weekend. They are family own place, reasonable price, good food, and good people :-)

They have a breakfast special. Before 10:30am you get two eggs w 3 sausages or 2 slices of beacons,  and 2 slices of toasts or 2 pancakes for $5!!! Their home potatoes are very tasty.  

We are very happy to have this place in our neighbor :-)
author: Fudedebobo K.

description:
Definitely a tiny little unexpected hole in the wall but great food! Got the breakfast special, two pancakes or toast, two eggs, and bacon or sausage all for $5 (4.50 before 10am) and add potatoes for 1.50. It was super delicious and definitely will come back for food. 

pros: 
delicious food, 10/10 would come back
Super cheap, nothing on menu is more than $10

Cons: 
Cash only :/
Not enough seating, Hard to seat a large group 
Had to wait a while for food
author: Megha C.

description: Friendly neighborhood spot . $5 breakfast special for 2 x pancakes, 2 x eggs and 2 x sausage links . Great place for inexpensive breakfast cravings .
author: Joe L.

description:
Such a weird place. Chinese diner? Wow! Sad that I don't see more Chinese fusion food.  I guess have option for a side of rice and seeing soy sauce on the table as a condiment didn't cut it for me.

Excellent hot cakes. It didn't come out of a box. It is definitely not that overly fluffy fake butter, fake everything pancakes. Its chewy and delicious. 

French toast was pretty good too. Have to try more dishes before I can judge. But so far not bad. Good old greasy diner food.  Terrific after hang over. 

Real good price. $4 for classic breakfast.
author: Helen L.

description:
A greasy spoon diner in the 'hood, but our first time.  We've only been living nearby for several decades.   They are open for breakfast and lunch only.  It's a corner storefront.  Long and narrow.  Booths that seat two comfortably but four can fit.   And counter service.  

Cheap and decent size portion breakfast.  They have burgers and sandwiches on the menu too.

We both had breakfast.  Talk about carbs.  White processed flour.   Nothing outstanding but if you don't feel like making breakfast at home, this place will be a good substitute.  Artificial maple syrup.   

Good coffee.
author: Shirley N.

description:
If you're looking for a simple, cheap breakfast, I would say that this is the place to go. Run by a nice Chinese family, this cafe makes great American breakfast dishes. The prices have gone up apparently but still cheaper than going to any other American chain diners.

Going before 10AM is $4.00 and anytime after is $4.50 for eggs, toast or pancakes, and bacon or sausage (Breakfast Special). They also have a lot of other breakfast options to choose from that are also relatively cheap. They provide a larger portion of sides if you want to get potatoes or fruit (not included in the special). I have tried a lot of bacon in my day and I would say the bacon here is delicious. It's not overly greasy but has a nice bit of crispiness to it, which I love. My wheat toast was nicely buttered and went so well with sunny side up eggs. I'm drooling just thinking about it again!

As with any SF location, this place is fairly small so sometimes it tends to get crowded but I didn't have too much of a wait going at 11AM. 

This place is CASH ONLY!
author: Kathy V.

description:
This is a great breakfast spot! Upon entering, you can tell that the people that run this cafe really care about its diners because they are so friendly! It's no wonder that a lot of regulars come here. 

I ordered the Irish breakfast after a lot of thought and an orange juice. The orange juice wasn't that good - it seemed watered down. But my Irish breakfast was delicious! It was my first time having that, and everything was cooked perfectly. 

On the backside of the menu, there are lunch items, and a lot of the burgers sounded yummy!
author: Rachel H.

description:
Looking for delicious, inexpensive breakfast?  Then Taraval Cafe is the place for you. My girlfriend and I come twice a week and grab their breakfast special, which consists of your choice of pancakes or toast, eggs, bacon or sausage for only $4.50, and if you make it before 10AM it's $4.00 ( that's less than a Starbucks' grande latte. 

Will definitely keep coming!
author: Miguel V.

description: Best brunch ever! The California scramble was amazing!! Cash only but reasonably priced for SF.
author: Christie V.

description: This place was great! I had the veggie scramble that was very tasty. The dish came with a choose of side and I selected the fruit, and I was happy I did. The fruit side came with an assortment of nicely sliced fruit. Taraval Cafe is a great value for the price.
author: Joseph T.

description: Only giving a 3 because the prices are great. Otherwise the coffee is horrible and no decaf. The food was average not much flavor. Potatoes were dry with no salt. The bathroom was disgusting.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Cheap, filling and fast. 

5 star approved.
author: Kristy F.

description: Old style American breakfast place with community feeling. Good way to start the day.
author: Stanley H.

description:
Cheap food, great service. 

Appears to be a family run place. I always end up getting the Irish breakfast and it never disappoints. French toast is also incredible.
author: Kevin Y.

description:
Cheap for great value.  Funny and kind family servicing the entire restaurant.  I used to go to Tennessee Grill (which is still good) but find myself gravitating here for a quick breakfast and coffee.

You'd never think that this spot would have such legit Italian Sausage, blood sausage and pork chops with eggs!  Everything $10 and under.  Their french toast is fluffy and homemade with the thickest egg batter.  

I go here with my man to eat like kings on a budget or even with a group of 6 (only one table in the back that can hold this much) that I brought today--6 people for $60 bucks with fully meals, extra french toast and drinks.  Can't beat it!
author: Nadia D.

description: GREAT food. Little hole-in-the-wall place. If you're coming down Taraval, you may blink and miss it. Great service. They give off a family vibe, like they make you feel like you're coming to their home for breakfast. I love it. It's such good food, and is reminiscent of a breakfast joint in San Jose off of Saratoga Avenue, Bill of Fare. Same style food. Almost exactly the same style food. SO GOOD. Potatoes, eggs, waffles, pancakes, french toast, the MILK is so creamy and delicious. OMG. I'm getting super hungry right now, and there's NO place like this in yucky Sacramento. Can't wait till the next time I visit SF. I will definitely be back for your food Taraval Cafe!
author: Carissa C.

description: Waiters are polite except the short bald guy who has an attitude. Food was ok. Cash only is annoying.
author: Vu N.

description: Dope spot! Customer service and food is on point! Back here for the 2nd time! Still dope! New fave spot
author: Disre N.

description: In this city of $5-$20 Artisan coffee, I'm happy to find this mom and pop breakfast place in the Sunset.  It might not look like much but it's clean with friendly service! I sat at the counter and everything look fresh, especially the fruits.  I had their Breakfast special of Eggs with Bacon or Sausage and Toast or Pancake which was only $4.50 before 10AM and $5 after.  Yes, that's Bacon, Eggs and Pancake for $5, less than the price of coffee elsewhere in the city. You can go Outerland if you want fancy breakfast and don't mind the 1 hour wait but if you want regular breakfast done perfectly without waiting forever or breaking the bank, this is the place.
author: Stanley T.

description: Excellent breakfast/brunch option. Simple greasy spoon at super affordable prices. Love this place.
author: Jalyn F.

description:
I got the California scramble and he got the corned beef brisket breakfast special. Our food was really good, although I thought the brisket was a little too salty.

It's cash only, prices are cheap but a tad tiny in size. Our waitress was attentive and we got our cups refilled with water and coffee several times. Definitely would go back in the future!
author: V M.

description:
Old school corner café, if I didn't know better I'd thought I was in Mayberry instead of SF. The place may be named NEW Taraval Café but everything inside and out looked well worn. Fairly standard breakfast menu I decide on one of my favorites, corned beef hash and eggs (this just didn't look like a place where a veggies dish would be their forte). Unfortunately I found out, neither is their corned beef hash and eggs. The corned beef was rather bland, the eggs well were eggs and their English muffins tasted generic. For the hash part of this dish I prefer my potatoes shredded and made like hash brown, New Tara's come chunky.
The service was a bit abrupt. I asked for a receipt and what I got was blank ordering check with just the amount written on it, no logo, no name, no what was served, just the amount. Also interesting was they did not have business cards nor take out menus, lucky I remember their name for this Yelp review!
Next time? I may give it another try - maybe one of their sausage dishes.
author: Eddie C.

description:
Walked in here to grab some breakfast while getting a SMOG check up the street.

Ordered the Denver.  It came with home fried potatoes and 2 slices of toast.  The omelette was cooked perfectly!  Just a little oozy in the middle...  The potatoes needed a lot of salt to bring it out of the bland.

I was starving, so I ordered a side of Sausage and a side of Corned Beef Hash.  The Sausage was okay.  There was an overwhelming herbal taste to it and not a lot of the porky flavor that I was craving.  I'll try their bacon or Italian sausage next time.  The Corned Beef Hash was pretty darn good.  I'd order that again.

I'd definitely come back the next time I'm in the area again!

Thanks for the good food!
author: John M.

description:
Service was impeccable! Never had to ask for refills on my coffee,  which was always hot and perfectly brewed. Packed house,  30 min wait for our food (2 New Taraval Specials,  and an order of French Toast)..not too bad,  considering there's only one cook and the place is packed.  Unfortunately,  when our food arrived,  it wasn't as pleasing as we'd hoped.  Our French Toast was extremely eggie, *no flavor; the scrambled eggs too soft and runny....one positive,  the Bacon was delicious!  Cooked perfectly! 
I will be back to try other dishes,  just never the French Toast again.  

*voiced concern with I assume the owner/manager. Apparently they only dip the bread in egg and powdered sugar,  due to possible good allergies of patrons.
author: LaTonda S.

description: I'm a savory, not sweet, kinda breakfast girl, but their French Toast is awesome! It's perfect alongside my eggs and bacon. Super affordable and great tasting food. You may have to wait in line on weekends, but it goes quickly and it's worth it. Traditional breakfast comfort food.
author: Seana H.

description: The food is great. The employees are super friendly. Very basic and tradition. The place is a bit small but who cares the food is great.
author: Lina W.

description:
The best thing about this place is the price. Came here with two friends and the three of us ate here for a mere $26, not bad at all.

Food was a bit more on the disappointing side. I had a scramble with a side of fruit. Just not a whole lot of flavor and it took quite a while for it to arrive at the table. Of course they were busy.

The staff though is incredibly attentive and friendly which is a plus, my coffee cup was never empty. :)

I would be interested in trying some of their other items. Will have to come back with a bigger appetite next time.
author: Alejandro T.

description: Great price, great food, great service, sign me up for a daily breakfast cause I'll come here everyday. Gets crowded in the weekends but pretty quick during the morning. The specials are great value and does justice for a morning meal. Eggs are awesome.
author: Thomas L.

description: It's a small place but the food is great and pretty cheap! The veggie omelette was loaded with veggies and fluffy, and the fruit was fresh.
author: Alex O.

description: Good food, really good prices. Very nice staff. Place is a bit small so go early and order the before 10am specials.
author: Dacia M.

description: A "Must Try" for any fan of a no-frills breakfast spot. Customer service is solid, prices are low and the portions are gratuitous. Love the home-cooked quality of the food as well. Would definitely be a regular whenever I visit the city.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
I've been here three times, and all I can say is that this place is the only breakfast place that reminds me of home. Not only is each serving an abundance in amount, but the menu is just so diverse, and all the items are simple just like what I would have when I go back home from college.

The corn beef hash is my favorite thing on the menu! The french toast is also great as well if you're extremely hungry.
author: Allyson W.

description:
Was starving and craving brunch so I walked in on a whim. Loved it!!

Atmosphere: it's a small diner. A lot like IHOP or Denny's. Very casual and smells delicious when you walk in. Definitely not a fancy/trendy  brunch spot but it's a great place to grab a quick late breakfast. 

Service: excellent!! Was greeted at seated as soon as I walked in. Always had a full cup or water and coffee. Everyone was very attentive and friendly. Plus, the food came out fast!

Food: alright but exactly what you'd expect from a diner brunch spot. Very tasty unless you're expecting an expensive brunchy meal. I ate every bite and enjoyed all of it.

Overall this place wins with service and prices. Don't expect the food to be fancy bc this is a diner. It was still delicious and Id definitely be back. 

Note: cash only! Come prepared! But prices are low so no need to bring too much. (My meal+coffee= $8)
author: Margaret O.

description:
Simple. Easy. Great tasting Omelettes at great prices. And good portions too. Friendly family staff. Really fluffy potatoes. Although if you arrive late, like I usually do, they sometimes run outta entrees on their menu.

A small diner with an aged feel. You'll know it on the booth seats [which have depressions] when you sit down. I just wish they had longer hours. But they do breakfast good and thats all that matters to me!

This is my Seinfeld/Monk's Restaurant.
author: Sammy L.

description: Very friendly, fresh fruit, just plain good breakfast that fits your budget! Can get crowded on weekends but not too bad of a wait.
author: Rochelle M.

description:
Breakfast has sorta become my thing. I never used to get it, but since I've been on the road I get it almost everyday. With that being said, I have been to many breakfast joints in the bay area (I usually search Yelp for diners) and New Taraval Cafe takes the proverbial hotcake.

I have eaten here twice now and have left satisfied both times. Both my stomach and wallet were full when I walked out the door. They have a $4 special that costs $4.50 after 10 AM. That's incredible! This is your quinessential classic diner.

The coffee is brewed to perfection and the home potatoes are my absolute favorite. Perhaps the best part, however, is the people who run the joint. They seem to be family from what I can surmise and they are extremely friendly and accomodating. I would say more, but I have a need to go slip into a food coma.
author: Jaime W.

description: Hit this place for breakfast at 8:00 on a Friday morning. Good to be early as it was almost empty at 8 am to just about full at 8:15. Parking was easy on the side street just a few feet from the door. The front door is a bit tired and makes you wonder what's inside but not to worry. Service was quick and friendly and as another reviewer said, positive. Coffee came right away and server came back with refills several times. The food is excellent! Good presentation and very tasty. My wife's veggie scramble with fresh fruit was outstanding. My french toast with scrambled eggs special was also excellent. The prices are very modest and make this a no brainer when in the area the next time. Cash only but you won't need much.
author: Pierce S.

description: Great service, great food. This is my favorite local breakfast spot. You can't beat the prices either. I don't even know how they make money.
author: Jamie W.

description:
The place is small and has an old-timey diner feel to it. The staff is friendly, but the food was sub-par and everything tasted weirdly like fish. The eggs I ordered were super greasy and the pancakes were nothing special. The orange juice they served us came out of a bottle of Simply Orange--but it tasted like it had been left open in the fridge and absorbed a bunch of funky flavors. My girlfriend ended up getting sick off of her scrambled eggs, but I did not. 

I guess, what can I expect from a meal that cost less than $10?
author: Amanda R.

description:
Food = good. 
Prices = cheap.  Bring cash.
Service = friendly.  Super friendly.

I no longer live near here, but I'll try to return here for a quick, cheap breakfast....
author: Fannie S.

description:
We were there last Saturday at 1:30 or so. Maybe we just came on the wrong day or at the wrong time, but service was bad. We had to ask for water and we had to ask for refills even though the server passed by our table several times.
Food is so-so. I'd rather pay more if it'll mean better food and better service.
author: Alex C.

description:
I went here with my sister a couple of weeks ago on a Sunday at noon and this place was packed. Luckily, since we were only a party of two, we were seated very fast. We soon ordered their special, which consists of two eggs, two sausages and two pancakes. 

Everything seemed pretty quick except for actually receiving our order. Around 20 minutes of sitting there, my sister noticed that tables seated before us still didn't get their dishes either. It took us almost an hour to get our plates and we ate everything within 5-10 minutes because we were starving. The food isn't anything amazing. It's something you could just make at home.

Long story short, the food is super cheap here but unless you have time to kill, I'd go somewhere else.
author: Stephanie L.

description: We came from out of town and picked this place from the reviews. I must say the food was decent. Asked for water and got huge glasses with no ice. My 2yr old also got a 30oz glass with no straw. I get that in the city things are different but not accepting credit cards or debit was awful. I had to jay walk across a busy street, wait in line at an ATM and pay a fee for cash. Jaywalk back and then pay a tip. I did give them a nice tip but only because they were nice and trusted me to return with the cash. On my way in I didn't see any "cash only signs" not impressed.
author: Jaime T.

description: Great place to grab a lazy morning meal, very affordable consider the location is costy.Great food with large portion.
author: Jesse Y.

description:
TC!!! Good, cheap, and fast.Menu is simple so don't make your order too complex. This isn't a place where you pour over the menu trying to find something. You want eggs, bacon, and potatoes? They got 'em. Breakfast for two for under $15.

Food is tasty, orders are made quickly, and the coffee is never-ending.

Favorite meal: corned beef hash and eggs, (canned but still good).
author: Dave D.

description:
We stopped by here this past weekend. The waitstaff was friendly enough but they seem to be a little bit disorganized.  I was asked by 4 different people on how many ppl we had (2)...and then they lost track of who was there first especially if you talked to one person and then you went outside to wait...you can easily be forgotten if someone else went inside and waited.

Place isn't the cleanest but I get it, its a local neighborhood joint which was fine...but I have to say, they probably should fix the booth cushions...bc it literally had people's butt shape engraved on it. I had to sit on the side bc it just felt nasty to sit in the same crevices that other people's butts been in haha. 

Food was delivered quickly. I got the Taraval special which was 3 french toast, 2 eggs, and 2 sausages (or bacon if you preferred).  It was fine...but my bf got the vegetarian omelet and it was still too runny for his taste. We didn't send it back because we didn't offend but the waitress noticed that he didn't touch his food when she gave us our billed...and said that we should have but it was fine. 

Overall experience:
Staff - 3 stars
Food - 3 stars
Decor - 2 stars
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Solid place well priced clean service brilliant fast friendly.
FYI cash only portion size good food not crazy good but filling and good value
author: obgyn K.

description: We're from Los Angeles here on a mini vacation and staying with family, we had to find somewhere for breakfast my wife found a place it was a lil walk but it was worth it . The place is small but the food here is big in flavor and quality . I will come here again when I'm here again
author: Julio V.

description: Great hole in the wall spot in the sunset for a quintessential breakfast meal. If you like fast, simple, reasonably priced food that comes in large portions, this place beats Denny's any day.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Love this Mom and Pop diner -now their kids are running it too.

Great, straightforward food. The folks who run this place are hard working, kind, and no nonsense. They've spiffied up the place some with new paint colors, new furniture, updated look, but it's still a great homey diner. 

We have been coming here forever and a day. It's a little gem, don't expect fancy food, or any other type of airs. But they are beloved in the neighborhood, and MUCH MUCH better than the other diner down the block that shall go unnamed.
author: cg w.

description: Skip this place it's a waste of time and money.  Forgettable food and extremely slow service.   Had to wait for a table.  Then after finally getting a seat took almost 40min to get an egg scramble.  Food is awful.    Potatoes not seasoned at all.  Veggie egg scramble was a watery mess.    Just avoid it and go down the street to Tennessee Grill or Copper Kettle.
author: Graham T.

description:
Great standard American breakfast fare in a tiny little mom and pop shop. Really great fast friendly service.

I always switch between the joe's special (add cheese) and the corn beef hash plate. The potatoes are always perfectly cooked : crunchy outside and soft and tender inside. All plates are around $6-8. 

Pancakes are fluffy and just sweet enough that you don't need to add syrup if you don't want to.

It gets crowded after 930am. But only because people are trying to get the early bird special (before 10am $4 special) : 2 eggs, 2 bacon or sausage, 2 pancakes or toast. But if you can make it before 8:30am, you are gold. No lines no waiting.

My only complaint is that the seats need updating. I'm constantly sitting in a huge groove.
author: Corinne W.

description: Had a great brunch here with my bf! The menu is quite simple: eggs, bacon, sausage and pancakes, nothing too fancy- but it's definitely a good price-quality balance. The waiters are really friendly and there is a nice vibe; everybody is relaxed, students catching up and families enjoying their weekend. If you want to have a good Sunday breakfast- not having to stand in line like at the most SF breakfast hotspots- this is a good option!
author: Kira U.

description:
I never give bad reviews to people because I try to be understanding, so this was the exception.

The foods here is excellent and the price is good.   The cook "forgot his name" seems pretty cool.   Only giving low stars because Mary is an angry short tempered miserable b-ouch that gets tick off easily.   The other reviewer "Corey W. on 3/13/2014" reviewed it best.
author: Tony W.

description: This is a great mom and pop type breakfast/lunch spot. A fairly small menu, but the food is always good, portion size is good, price is great, service is great. The only complaint I can say is that there is often a line ;)
author: Ian L.

description: Came here yesterday with my sister. Cheap breakfast place but nothing special. My sister ordered her eggs over easy and I asked for my eggs to be medium (no runny yolk) but both came out very runny and goopy like sunny side up eggs. Tiny place that gets pretty loud but nice and fast service.
author: Julie C.

description: This is the BEST breakfast spot in the Sunset. I come here at least twice a week. Great portion sizes and good prices! Highly recommend!!
author: Ryan S.

description: I don't understand how this place is cash only?!the parking meters in front of the building take card!
author: Tony G.

description: I don't know how this old couple turn disgusting Cisco and Costco food products into delicious breakfast, but I'm grateful that they can and do.
author: austin b.

description: Super bomb and super local.  Looks like a hole in the wall but will fill your whole tummy with bomb food.  Plentiful and delicious!!
author: Kyle N.

description: Perfect place for a weekend morning brunch with your family and friends. Affordable breakfast options that include pancakes, eggs, toast, sausage, ham, and anything else you want. I ordered a house special which came with a pancake, two sausages, and scrambled eggs. It was filling and delicious! I recommend ordering a fresh orange juice with your breakfast to cleanse your palate. I can't wait to visit here again!
author: Joanne K.

description:
The lady who is always working there, deals with the money from customers and immediately goes and grabs the toast and butter with her bare hands. It's really gross and unsanitary. Just saying...
But aside from that it's really cheap (cash only) and really good, if you're willing to take that risk.
author: Pari A.

description: Hardy breakfast at a low price.  Just remember this place is cash only.  Corned Beef Hash, 2 eggs over easy and house potatoes; Pancakes and side order of Bacon perfect and delicious.  Will come back again for sure.
author: Cheryl W.

description: Breakfast before 10am only $3.50-$3.95 for a combo. They don't use that cheap egg mix to save money they use real eggs fresh veggies and fruit. Staff here is attentive and friendly, if something isn't on the menu they will still accommodate you. Cash only! Hole in the wall, eat at the counter or sit at an old cramped booth. You can tell this place is old when people were smaller and thinner and could fit into small places. I would of given it a 5 star but they don't have whip cream and the is a must on my hot chocolate.
author: Roxanne O.

description: Great homestyle breakfast for a reasonable price.  Staff was friendly and attentive.  The chicken Apple sausage and the French toast was very good.
author: Edward V.

description:
You need to go to this cafe for breakfast first thing tomorrow morning or else die a slow and painful death by rabid squirrels.

No, seriously though, this place is AMAZING. I got the Monterey omelet and it was one of the best things I've ever had. Can you say, party in your mouth?!

HUGE portions + great price + friendly service = COME HERE!
author: Kei H.

description: Love this place! It's cheap and decent taste! Good portion sizes! The only thing is its cash only. Other than that, love this place!
author: Maggie H.

description:
It's pretty nice coffee house, the menu just one breakfast special $ 3.50,( the breakfast special which is two eggs any style, 2 strips of bacon (or sausage), and two hotcakes (or toast), for only $3.50 because it was before 10am! After 10am it's $3.95 which is still a really cheap,  and other are New taraval cafe is $ 6.25 and Irish breakfast is $ 8.50
I order new taraval cafe with bacon, and I ask them half bacon and half sausage        ( because bacon 4 strips or sausage 4 strips ), so you just choose one style only.
My wife order Mushroom Omelet, it is ok, and coffee free refill. ( but if you only order coffee, you must pay cup by cup, of course, the second and the third one should be cheaper )but if you ask hot water , must pay $ 0.5.
The waitress can speak Cantonese and all staff are friendly.

這是相當不錯的咖啡館, 菜單只有一個早餐特價$3.50，( 早餐特價是兩個雞蛋任何類型
 ，2條培根（或香腸），和兩個熱蛋糕（或烤麵包片），僅售3.50美元因為它是早10點前！上午10時後它的3.95美元這仍然是一個非常便宜的 )和其他的new taraval cafe為$6.25和愛爾蘭早餐8.50美元. 
我點 new taraval cafe 和 選擇培根，我問他們一半培根一半香腸，但他們說他們不能做到這一點。( 因為培根4條或香腸4條 )，所以你只可以選擇一種.
我的妻子為了蘑菇煎蛋卷，還可以. 咖啡可以免費任喝。（但如果你只點咖啡，你一定要一杯計算, 當然，第二，第三個杯更便宜）但如果你問熱水，一定要0.5美元.
女服務員能講廣東話和所有工作人員都很友善
author: Eric W.

description: brings back great memories. i have been going here since I was selling the chronicle here as a kid back in the 90's. Ownership looks like it has changed but the quality in food and great service have not. The place also got a nice face lift with new benches!! Highly recommend for cheap and cheerful food
author: Mark C.

description:
YES. 

Hung over? Come here.

Want a delicious breakfast at normal people prices (ie NOT SF prices)? Come here.

It feels like home. Their food isn't the fancy SF "frittata with fancy cheese and some sort of strange amalgamation of spices and herbs". You get eggs. You get sausage. You get bread. You get omelettes. Simple. 

It's kind of a relief, actually. I love the city and I love the cool, experimental foods here. But sometimes you need something homey without actually having to cook. And this is the place to go. 

All the locals come here, so you should come here! But after me. Sometimes there's a line, and I don't want to wait haha
author: Jade R.

description:
My friend and I dined in for breakfast twice now and we love it! It just feels homey because the staff make you feel so welcomed. They have some pretty good breakfast deals if you come early enough too. I'm pretty sure I'm going to be a regular here. 

TIPS: Cash only

We didn't know it was cash only the first time, but thank goodness there's Banks/ATM at Walgreens nearby.  One of us was going to stay behind, so they know we're not dining and ditching, but the server said he trusted us. More tip for you, Sir! 

Great breakfast & service!
author: Harlice v.

description: Very inexpensive breakfast can be had here in the mornings. I felt like I was taking a gable going into this place based on the reviews. I can't speak for others, but I had a good experience.
author: Frederick J.

description: total hole in the wall joint... throwback place with regulars n they could recite the order right when they walked in. super affordable n food was legit!
author: rich c.

description:
Not one thing about this diner sucks. It makes me really happy I only live a block away. The best part is that they have this WONDERFUL breakfast deal... 2 hotcakes or 2 pieces of toast/ 2 pieces of bacon or sausage/ 2 eggs for about $4. add about a dollar more for pretty fantastical potatoes... and BAM, you have my heart. I love a good, filling, and cheap breakfast. 

I've also tried their bacon avocado burger, which was delicious as well. 

The star for me is the potato goods: whether it be hash browns or french fries... I am a major fan of what they do [pretty sure everything is par boiled then put to work in whatever fashion they want!] 

The service is always always always good, and they remember you after the first few visits. 

I love that even when it is busy, they don't leave you hanging. The waitress even saw that we needed the check and told us the amount as she was servicing other people so we could be on our way. 

This is certainly a recommended stop if you are in the area!
author: Megan V.

description:
Best damn breakfast in town. 

Before 9 am on a weekday, you can get pancakes, eggs, sausage, and coffee for about $4. So cheap. Perfect for those mornings where I wish it was the weekend but it's not, and I have to grab something hearty before I head to school/work. 

Place is super run-down but acceptably clean and charming, and the people who run it have great personalities!
author: Lauren P.

description:
Family-owned diner. Great service, great food. 

I ordered the Denver Omelette and it was absolutely delicious! The portion size was big and the price inexpensive. I would definitely come back again.
author: Cass Y.

description:
"LET'S GO PANCAKING!!!!!" that's what my friend (Auntie Jemima) and I use to say. This place was our place to eat pancakes. 

Since I haven't stepped into this place in YEARS, I decided to make a date with my sis & mom and go pancaking. 

I don't think you an go to any other place that sells pancakes cheaper than this place. If you know of any, let me know. After 10AM (the only time I can go), for $3.95 you get: 2 hotcakes or toast, 2 eggs, & 2 sausages/bacon. For an additional $1.25 you can get home fries & those are OH SO GOOD. Get the home fries, I guarantee they're worth it, crispy on the outside and soft inside. I can never finish everything, so I take the rest home. If you get there before 10AM, it's $3.50, I think. I can never get here before 10AM, I've got work and school. 

The workers are nice, I like that.

Don't go to IHOP or Denny's (it's more expensive there), support your local mom & pop shop and come eat here.

They're closed Tuesdays, but open the rest of the week.
author: Kylie L.

description:
New Taraval Cafe looks like a retro diner on the inside. It's pretty nice to see those are still around and kicking.

== Food ==

I had the Denver omelet and a side of sausage. It tasted pretty good.

Didn't really like the potatoes. They were be chunks of potato that were pan fried a bit. 

== Service ==

Service was quick and nice.

== Overall ==

Makes good standard issue breakfast food without and frills.
author: Steven B.

description:
Love this place!(: 
It gives off a homey vibe and the food are delicious and inexpensive!
Breakfast special is the cheapest, most filling and, delicious. Add the home fried potatoes and it's all about $5. Worth it!
author: Windy L.

description: Quick, dirty, no-nonsense breakfasts.  Awesome family-owned and operated, greasy spoon joint out on this end of the Bay Area.  I really enjoyed it and will come back again!
author: Gil R.

description: My gf and I saw this place here on yelp and decided to check it out! We didn't get a chance to try their food since we had to walkout before we even had a chance to sit down and take our orders. When we came everything seems fine, but when it was our turn to sit and my gf ask politely if we can take booth table, the old chinese lady replied "Can you see that!" pointing at the other tables with 3 and more people which it did not make sense b/c there was also a couple right next to the table we wanted to sit in which is exaclty the same booth table. There was no one behind us waiting nor was ahead of us waiting to be seated. This lady was rude b/c my gf asked nicely if we can sit in the booth table instead of being in front of the rest room. If she would've just politely answered back to us with a simple Yes or No, we would've understand. So my gf and I just walked out and told ourselves to never even come back to this place. How do people open stores like this one? When the person who tried seating me and my gf down is so rude, needs to take ESL and don't know what customer service is the 1st place! F this place! If there was a zero star I would give this place less than a zero star!
author: Jansen B.

description:
There is nothing better than a mom and pop cafe with good family vibes, good old fashion breakfast ( Nothing fancy here). Did I mention the food is delicious? 
Best part of all, you don't have to break the bank to treat your family for a hearty breakfast!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Prices=really cheap
Food=mediocre
Service=friendly

Okay for a quick, cheap breakfast.
author: Katie W.

description: Super bomb and super local.  Looks like a hole in the wall but will fill your whole tummy with bomb food.  Plentiful and delicious!!
author: Laura P.

description:
A small mom and pop diner on the corner of Taraval and 20th. You walk in and immediately receive a friendly greeting. It's so small you can hear 4 different conversations going on around you. Pretty good coffee. Decent hash browns and a huge amount)for 5+ bucks for coffee ,2 eggs,toast and this humangous pile of hash browns. You won't go away hungry or poor.

Only one lady waiting and clearing tables...she works her ass off..
author: Bleep S.

description: I really enjoyed the food and service here. The portion is huge for what they charge. My scrambled eggs tasted really delicious. The place is very small, so don't expect fancy breakfast place. We received excellent service so we left a big tip for the workers. If we visit the part of town again, we will definitely visit again!
author: Mai M.

description: Best pancakes I've tried (fluffy and tasty).  My son loved their burger and he is a picky eater. Overall delicious food and the owner is very friendly and attentive to customers.
author: Caroline S.

description: Friendly service, my review is for the food. i would give 5 stars for prices, 1 star for CASH ONLY which is annoying. and 2 stars for food. I ordered scrambled eggs , french toast and sausages (new taraval special) and my eggs werent cooked all the way, they came watery with yolk to the table. yuck! the french toast was just plain white bread with batter. nothing special, no cinammon or other condiment. true Ive been spoiled by the french toast at Precita Cafe which are cinammon and a homemade organic maple butter and apple cider syrup which is Amazing!!! This place was sub par and they didnt even bring butter with my french toast. would not go back.
author: Christina M.

description:
New Taraval Cafe is amongst a dying breed of small, no-frills, family-owned, greasy spoon diners in the city. It's run by a local Chinese family -- the mom will often take your order, the sister will refill your coffee, and you can witness the brother(s) and dad cooking away on the hot open grill upon entrance. It is cheap, delicious, and homey - all in the most un-ironic way possible. 

It's not a Dottie's, a Mama's, or a Brenda's, and you certainly won't even wait a small fraction of what you'd be enduring to snag a table at any of those places on a weekend. Though it may be more comparable to a Mel's Diner or a Denny's in terms of the genre of food, the freshness and dirt-cheap prices definitely set them apart from the aforementioned diner-chains. They range from $3 simple egg/meat platters to $6-$7 hefty omelette dishes that come with a stack of toast and endless jelly packets.

Aside from the wallet-friendly price points, the food is simple - not fussy, hot, and delicious. My personal favorites are the corned beef hash or their Italian sausage omelette. Most of their plates come with a heaping brick of fluffy crispy hash browns and a plate of English muffin slices or toast triangles, and everything hits the spot when you're hankering for some simple, quick, egg-meat-and-potatoes American or Irish-style breakfasts.

True, it's not quite a destination in an ever-so-gentrifying city that embraces its bourgeois-foodie frou-frou culture more than ever. But, that doesn't make it any less of a local gem, which it totally, totally is.
author: Betty W.

description: This place is a real diner. Cash only. They have Tobasco and Sriracha, but you have to ask for the Tobasco (very precious). Don't assume the omelet will have cheese. If you like family run diners over corporate garbage this place is it. (老闆娘會粵語）
author: Chris S.

description: I wouldn't trust this place. If the edibility is questionable, you should take the extra buck that you saved and use it at Tennessee Grill next time.
author: Anastasia P.

description: Great little spot. Reminds me of an old school diner that you see in movies.  Prices are good and service is polite and very fast
author: Joel G.

description:
This is your typical greasy spoon spot, and I loved that it was so accessible to where we were staying. $3.50 for a breakfast combo before 10, $3.95 after. This for two eggs any style, toast or muffin, bacon or sausage. Add on an OJ and you're out the door for under $8. Who doesn't love a great deal like that? 

It was a busy spot so our service lagged a little bit, but they work hard to turn tables over pretty quickly as the space itself is on the small side.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
If you want a cheap breakfast, this is your spot.

We both had one of their breakfast specials, your typical pancakes and eggs, or bacon eggs and toast, and drinks, and walked out of their for $15 with tip.  That's the bomb.com right there.  

It's a total mom and pop joint, but they've got sriracha on the tables and a Maneki-neko at the door which is hilarious, but speaks to the area it's in. This is a great spot for a quick and cheap breakfast!
author: Drew M.

description: Very good and inexpensive breakfast in the Sunset/parkside district of San Francisco, love their corned beef hash
author: Jack W.

description: Came for Breakfast and the staff super friendly and the food was very good. I had California Scramble with fruit all very fresh.  The 6 of us had a good breakfast for under $40.00!  Kids loved it too!  No children menu but they will take the adult menu and adjust it.  Coffee a bit strong but I am a week coffee drinker.  Will go back!
author: Grace M.

description:
Cheap breakfast! 
What is there left to say?  
This place is inexpensive and its breakfast.  Those two words together should be enough for anyone. 

This review is based on the breakfast only, I have never had anything there that wasn't breakfast.
author: Sawyer F.

description:
Cheap, good food and nice servers.

Hard to find a place in SF that has $4.50 breakfast. I like it.
author: Jace A.

description: I stopped in here after a blood test at Labcorp. This was a really good breakfast. My wife and I left full and happy. We didn't have to spend much money!
author: Chase L.

description:
Imagine an old school greasy spoon diner with Irish breakfasts, run by a friendly Chinese couple.  She waits on tables, he cooks the food.  Prices are cheap, portions are generous and the service is very efficient.  She refilled my cup of coffee countless times (the coffee wasn't so good but I didn't expect it to be).  Yes, they have counter seating and vinyl booths...but they also have a Chinese shrine.

A corned beef hash breakfast with eggs, toast and your choice of bacon, sausage or ham is $6.  They have Irish sausage and pudding.  They're probably known for their breakfasts but they also have burgers, steak, and sandwiches (including teriyaki ones). 

* New Taraval special $6.25. Two eggs served your way, hash browns, your choice of bacon, ham or sausage, and buttered toast.  Very solid.  The golden hash browns were slighty crispy on the outside, soft on the inside.  The sausages (4 links) were good quality, firm, juicy and flavorful.  Even the toast was nicely toasted (not too much, not too little).  Eggs were poached properly.

The place looks old and feels a little sticky.  The pictures on the wall are faded.  But, they're serving up good diner food at good prices.  For some reason it always looks closed.  Note, they close early, at 2 PM.  

Cash only.
author: Lolia S.

description: I've lived in the sunset my whole life and walked by this place only a zillion times. I never thought to give it a chance because from the outside, the place looks closed. I actually thought it was just an unoccupied building until today. If you haven't gone here, you must give this place a shot. It's always nice to support local businesses anyway. The prices are so affordable I felt like a thief, so I tipped generously. Nice place to go alone if you want to enjoy a meal with a good book, or with friends. It's very cozy.
author: L. Y.

description: Fluffy and light pancakes served with eggs and sausage for under $5 - best deal in the area! Love the family feel here and will be back to try more!
author: Jimmy H.

description: This is my weekly breakfast place. It's like walking into my grandmas kitchen and having her make me a BLT with lettuce and tomatoes fresh from her garden. It's small and cozy and the nicest family runs it, you really can't get a better family breakfast spot!
author: Caitlyn C.

description: My girlfriend came here to grab a quick bite. We had to wait a few minutes but it was worth it. The breakfast was so good. We both had the breakfast special which was only $4. Heads up, this place is cash only
author: Andrew K.

description: Mary, the owner/waitress retired, her family is taking over, it will take some time to pickup where Mary left off. I hope.
author: SJ L.

description: Love this little dive. The place isn't pretty, but it does a great breakfast for like, pretty much free. Pancakes, ham, homefries, toast, and omelets mmmmm and they're Asian so they have sriracha mmmmmm. Eggs + sriracha = life.
author: Jenny J.

description: Perfect place for a CHEAP, FAST, GREAT tasting American breakfast!! My boyfriend and I each got the "breakfast special" which consists of 2 eggs, 2 slices of buttered toast OR 2 large fluffy pancakes, and 2 bacon strips OR 2 sausages. Each plate was only $3.50!!!! We also ordered a side of delicious hash browns for only $1.25 more which was enough to share between the both of us!!! The food was perfect and the service was friendly and fast. This is not a fancy place to have breakfast. It is a small, old, family owned, whole in the wall type of diner but the food is great and super cheap, which is why I give them 5 stars!
author: Lynn T.

description:
Delicious and cheap!

I love coming here for early breakfasts or brunch. It's an incredible deal! You can order a short stack of pancakes, bacon, two eggs, a large helping of potatoes and leave only five dollars poorer. It's insane! I love their Taraval breakfast deal and the friendly, neighborhood atmosphere. I generally sit at the bar since I come here for breakfast by myself. The place sometimes gets crowded if you're looking for a booth, but the wait is never too long. The staff is very friendly especially if you become a regular. 

I've had their corn-beef hash as well as some of their omelettes. It's all delicious breakfast foods and you pretty much can't go wrong. They have some specials from time to time that might appeal to me, but I really can't skip over the breakfast deals they have. 

Good for hangovers, lazy Sundays, before taking a tourist around town, cheap eats and a good breakfast deal. Highly recommended!!
author: Larry Y.

description:
If you want the bottom-line: it's cheaper than Tennessee Grill, but not as good. 

Food's solid. Not amazing. But if you get there early in the morning, it's pretty affordable. And the proprietors will never give you shit about anything. Sometimes that's what you want - a place where you can throw down a couple of bucks and get some coffee and some middling breakfast food and lean on the counter and not deal with any of the bullshit that's out there in the world.  And if that is an experience you value, New Taraval will reliably provide it.  Unless it's closer to lunch time, because after all it is near a high school.
author: Doug R.

description: Very friendly and always smiling was our waiter. Enjoyed the food and the prices were great... I will return again for their breakfast
author: Domingo D.

description:
What's old is new.

Someone forgot to tell the friendly owners of the mom and pop style New Taraval Cafe it is no longer the 70s. Prices, decor and service are  rather vintage.

Dining companion ordered the egg, pancake and coffee breakfast special. Four bucks. Two quarters more after 10:30am. We can handle that.

My egg white omelette was large, missing grease and came with fruit on the side (one of a few options). As healthy and delicious as the best of them.

Back a week later for a perfectly grilled chicken burger. More fruit. Another steal for seven bucks including tip.

Don't change your prices. Don't change your outdated menus. Don't change your service. 2012 needs more of 1972. And people like the folks running New Taraval.
author: Jason B.

description: Real diner. Spilled coffee on my 7 month year old daughter. Everything else after that didn't matter much.
author: Ryan K.

description:
This is really a hole-in-the-wall mom and pop place owned by a nice Chinese couple.
I find myself coming here on Christmas Day. I did that the past 2 years. It gives me fond memories because I get to hang out with my uncle and I get to spend some time with him before I have to go to do other Christmas festivities. 
The Breakfast Special is BOMB. It's under $5! Eggs, Meat (Bacon/Sausage), and I get Hash Browns - well done. Toast and Coffee or Tea round out the meal.
This place is a solid breakfast joint. Nothing fancy smancy- you get the basics. Prices are awesome and the service here is too.
author: Angela D.

description:
A nice little mom and pop shop. I often come here instead of Tennessee Grill, just because they seem more of a retirement home than a restaurant. 

This isn't the best and the cleanest place around, but it is the only place in the Parkside to get a decent eggs and toast with a side of coffee. The place also isn't very big so not good for groups bigger than 4 people.
author: M C.

description: I love the prices and the service! Definitely a mom-n-pop, where the woman greets, serves, prepares food and drinks, and her husband is behind the stove. Her son even helps sometimes. I always leave in a good mood and satisfied with the amount of food. The only complaint I have is that the hash browns tend to be very bland (almost like a pile of boiled potatoes) and the scrambled eggs can sometimes be undercooked. But the friendly service and great prices keep us coming back.
author: Amanda C.

description: Shocked to find such a quaint place after reading the reviews. They have 3 people running everything but they still manage get get everything out extremely fast. I got the mushroom egg white omelette with spinach and fruit. The food was simple, delicious and affordable!
author: Bobby T.

description: It's hard to mess up eggs and breakfast.  New Taraval Cafe is a solid 3 stars with decent breakfast food.  I have no complaints.  The staff is friendly and fast.  Food is decently priced.
author: Shirley T.

description: This place is just okay. My order of scrambled eggs and home fried potatoes came out runny and undercooked. I sent it back, and it returned marginally better. I won't be coming back.
author: mary g.

description: What a good find for breakfast.  We stopped by for breakfast after running the Rock and Roll Half Marathon.   Had breakfast and it was great.   Not a large space so we had to wait for a table but glad did.   Good standard fare at a reasonable price with friendly staff.   We would go here again.
author: Dawn H.

description: Great little place for a terrific breakfast! Had there breakfast special with home fries and it was a little to much for me to finish! Will be a regular there now! :)
author: Benjamin G.

description:
Good cheap food. I can say you get more than your money's worth here 
The breakfast is great, even though it has the feel of a Chinese restaurant don't let that fool you.
author: Kevin T.

description:
The breakfast here is pretty decent but overall the place is run down and very old inside. Prices are definitely good but the service sucks as well. The place is really small and I went with a group of like 15 for breakfast with my basketball team and they were able to accommodate us but it wasn't really comfortable.

Parking is street parking so remember to fill up your meter unless you find residential parking
author: M. L.

description: It's perfect for what it is... a cheap, friendly, tasty, local breakfast spot. The staff is great. Come here and enjoy a local gem.
author: Johnson M.

description: Found this place when I left my Dr.'s office.  I wanted something sweet & a latte. The donut shop had a mirror effect that caught my eye.  Directly across the street was New Taraval Cafe.  I figured the coffee & something sweet would cost at least $5-6.  I ordered pancakes & coffee.  Cost me altother $6 that's including the tip.  The food is good & fulfilling.  I always feel satisfied.  Mary is always on top of making sure your coffee is full.  I believe two of her kids have taken over.  Mary & her husband were very nice.  Always had a smile? & the food was Great. Miss you mucho Mary
author: Dee G.

description: The prices here are unbeatable, unless you're willing to give up quality. $4 for the special (inc. two pancakes, two eggs and two pieces of bacon or sausage). Proportions are large and the food itself is very good with a homemade taste. Will definitely be returning here in the near future.
author: Kaylee D.

description: This little mom and papa store can be easily over looked with all the other Asian Restaurants nearby.  The food here is really cheap.  you can get a breakfast special for under $4.00. Yep you read that right under 4.00 . You can't get much for $4.00 nowadays. $4.00 might just get you 30 mins for a parking meter space.  So why not spend your $4.00 here for a meal.   If you come before 10 a.m. you can get the special for $4.00.  The special comes with 2 eggs with 3 hotcakes or toast and choice or 2 strips of bacon or 2 sausages.   The place gets super busy,  if you have a big group it might be hard to get a table.  The portions are generous, and quite big, it was hard for me to finish my portion. Although the food was average, i still feel it's still worth it for the price you are paying.  I saw the other tables with the sandwiches and steak and it made me more hungry. My eyes are bigger then my stomach.  The next time I come back there I will try their sandwiches!
author: Belinda C.

description:
awesome spot for some cheap breakfast 3.50 before 10, 4.00 after woo hoo!

I would recommend staying away sunny side up eggs unless you like it a little undercooked on the top
author: Peter E.

description: Good breakfast cafe.  Service was super quick and very friendly.  One star taken away because they didn't serve decaf coffee.  I had to walk across the street to get a cup of decaf.
author: Helen P.

description: This is my favorite diner in the city. I've only been here twice, about 6 months apart, but the waiter remembered who I was. This place gets busy and is packed with locals. The menu is typical diner fair, with good coffee, a nice selection of toast and big portions. In a former life I lived in the outer sunset and I can't believe I just recently found this place.
author: Z N.

description: Well, went back after a five year hiatus.  Son and friends have taken over and same foods, good prices. One thing I noticed different was the fruit salad was prepared on the spot, not made and stored in a container.  The staff was a little slow in terms of taking an order and refilling your cup, but it does get done.  If you are in a hurry, don't and relax and have another cup.  The cook may not serve three scoops of those potatoes, just only two scoops.  I think he's trying to help us maintain our waistline.  Steve, one of the staff, has a memory like a steel trap.  Cash only
author: Rey D.

description: Quick, cheap and easy. It's the place to go for a traditional, no frills breakfast. Everything is pretty good, nothing is bad, it's my kind of place. Did I say cheap?
author: Caleb O.

description:
I live less than a mile away from New Taraval Cafe and have driven by at least 2-3 times a week.  Why have I never tried this place before, beats the pants off of me.  CHEAP EATS!  

I"ll have to agree with Theodore O.s review back in 2009.  "Corned beef hash, home fried potatoes, 2 eggs, toast and OJ  for 10$ with a tip"  You can't beat that now a days.  I've tried Dennys, Ihop, Bashful Bull & this place wins it be a long shot.  I believe I caught them on the day that this was their daily special so just the place along was $6.50 or $6.95 (somewhere in that price range of under $7 and about $.50 less since it was their daily special).  Seating is limited so get their early. You can get a full breakfast special with meat, eggs, toast/panckaes all for around $4.50  Yes folks, a full breakfast for under $5.
author: Stacey L.

description: Day 2.. Started with breakfast.. Wow... Small family joint.. With fabulous service and great food... I ordered 2 scrambled eggs with 3 French toast... What no way I got much more than I expected.. Day began with a good and healthy breakfast... Keep it up... You should definitely try....
author: Aisha K.

description: This is a cozy diner that leaves you with a good start to your day. The food and service is pretty good and they constantly check to provide refills. There was a bit of a wait but its just testimony to the faithful patrons who visit. Once seated though they provide quick service.
author: Peachie Y.

description: Quick and friendly service. Love their breakfast specials for only 4$! And it's family owned!
author: Suzan L.

description: Awesome place.  Good food and good prices.  Of course, not gourmet, but good quality, clean, good people.  Note: for rice lovers u can get that in lieu of potatoes
author: Dkac C.

description:
Before entering this establishment, you need to be prepared. You will have exactly 20 seconds to give your order before the waitress moves on. Think Seinfield Soup Nazi.  

The place has old style, grungy charm but is a diamond in rough. Where else can you get a great breakfast for 4 and pay only $24? 

Upon my first few visits, I made some embarrassing mistakes by asking to be served toast while waiting for our friends to join (how could I??) and by deliberating between two entrees when the waitress came by (vengeful eyes were given). I'm now a pro and spit out my order as the waitress is in transit towards our table: Taraval special, coffee, sunny side up, sausage, wheat toast!
author: Johanna W.

description: Great food, super cheap prices! Went here with my parents after reading the Yelp reviews and I'm glad I did! The corned beef hash is excellent, eggs great, good coffee!
author: Alicia M.

description:
New Taraval Cafe is a quick, cheap, dirty, no-frills, and satisfying breakfast option.

Characteristic of the Sunset district, the options at NTC lack the usual San Franciscan flair associated with breakfast.  Despite this, NTC provides solid fare that  is perfect for those too lazy to clean up in the home kitchen.  

The topside of the hash browns is consistently fried to a crisp, with the underlying layer left starchy enough to soak in the necessary mixture of ketchup and Tobasco; the sunny side up egg is left leaky to fill the crevices in the corned beef hash; and the toast is sometimes burnt but drenched in plentifully spread butter.

There is only one cook, leading to unexpected waits; the seats are diner-sticky; and there is no way to turn down the complementary oily smell that clings to your clothes and hair as you leave NTC.

NTC is a viable choice for a casual, low-maintenance weekend breakfast stop.
author: Andrew M.

description:
If you're turned off by a old setting (that's maybe dying for a renovation) or the fact that they are unapologetic (and not ashamed) by the fact that their ingredients might not be first class (i.e. juice from a bottle, corn beef from a can) then you'll probably want to avoid this place.

But if you like supporting a friendly family-run neighborhood business that takes care of its regulars and serves very cheap and delicious breakfast (you can get a belly bustin' breakfast for under $5), support the New Taraval Cafe.
author: Jeffrey J.

description: Went here yesterday morning and really liked it. The menu was simple but still had various options. I had the breakfast special, which included two pancakes, two eggs and two strips of bacon. And it was only $4. The prices are unbeatable! The service was super attentive and fast. We arrived before 10am and it was not crowded at all. The ambience was nothing special but I am a big fan of diner-like establishments, so I felt like I hit the jackpot!
author: Dodi G.

description:
The Bomb!!!
Tony and Mary are the hardest working folks in the biz...  The food is always hot and tasty and such a sweet deal!   The only reason I don't go everyday is well... I'm a Fitness professional and omelettes and home fries too often will certainly give me a bulge that I prefer not to advertise to current and potential clients... lol    However, as I tell my clients and live by, " Enjoy what you love once in a while..." Well, I love The New Taraval Cafe and I hope everyone in the Sunset and beyond has had the opportunity to fill there bellies with this true comfort food... Hip hip hooray!
author: Joseph A.

description: I've been coming here for as long as I can remember. To me, this place is great comfort diner food. I usually get either the breakfast special or the burgers. They're so good and the prices are amazing.  Did I mention the yummy coffee with refills? I'm in love with the home fries, and I've never had better. Cash only but there's a bank up the block. Take out some cash and eat here!
author: Kelsey C.

description: This place is cheap and good.  Shhhhhh it's a secret because the outside and the interior might scare you away, but I want them to stay open because I want to keep eating here.  It is small, so maybe don't tell too many more people you know.  The breakfast is huge and pretty standard, but you get a lot of food for cheap.  The best thing here are the burgers. Oh my god, a bacon, cheese and avocado burger with one side for less than $7 is unheard of in SF and it's way better than those artisan, hipster burgers over $11 sold everywhere that come with nothing else. The potato salad is real good because it's made with sweet relish.  This is a hole-in the wall place & I like it .
author: Sandy S.

description:
A great little place that you can easily miss, but it's worth checking out. The prices are very reasonable and the service is good. The pancakes are delicious and the home fries are excellent.

I love that they have a chicken option for burgers. The mushrooms and onions on the burger were cooked perfectly. I'll enjoy going back time and again for breakfast and/or lunch.
author: Sara K.

description: YUCK!  This place should be called New Terrible Cafe.  Others may think it's good, but I got the Steak 'n Eggs here.  I got the eggs sunny side up, which they had THE NERVE to call it half-cooked eggs.  I get it.  Maybe that is the real name, but they call it that for a reason.  Now that my stomach is rumbling and gurgling, I'm regretting ever stepping foot in this place.  It gets a one star rating because I didn't like the service, food, and it's CASH ONLY!  I mean c'mon!  It's the 21st century!.
author: Sam K.

description: super cheap menu with large servings! pretty much like a denny's but with a mom & pop feel. The servers are friendly and everything is cooked behind the bar. No sneaky business! My breakfast was $4. Can you beat that???
author: Lisa N.

description: We wanted to try a new breakfast place, we were near by so we passed by. They only take cash but there was a BofA across the street. The food was good, the waiter was great and most important the price was right!! Definitely a must try!
author: Ana M.

description:
Not good for Non-Meat eater. Unless you order pancake or other side dishes... 

Service wasn't that good either... We sat by the counter, but had to ask several times for refill coffee or anything... 

Not going back again.
author: Cindy C.

description:
Hi all, 

I was able to wake up on time to meet the Girlfriend for breakfast at a restaurant called New Taraval Cafe. At first, I didn't want to go in. I assumed the food wouldn't be so good because the exterior looked run down. If the outside looked bad, wouldn't the food taste bad as well? I let the Girlfriend know of my concerns since I had been food poisoned at similar looking establishments, but she forcefully told me it was nothing to worry about since it is a popular and well known place. Looks like I had no opinion in the matter. Cool! All I wanted was to avoid food poisoning so trying it out was not problem. 

We walked in and found the place bustling. There were plenty of people sitting at the bar right next to the entrance and at the red booths lined along the walls. An old Asian lady with a bowl-cut hair style -- who I believe to be the proprietor -- seated us in one of the red booths. She wore an apron, pink sweater, and a joking attitude on her face. When a pair of elderly patrons were leaving, she told one of them, "Thank you, young lady" and the patron retorted "You must not see very good," to which she just wholeheartedly laughed it off and continued to complement on her non-existent youthful appearance. The patron left the restaurant smiling. 

I ordered an Irish Breakfast and coffee and the Girlfriend ordered french toast. When I hear the Girlfriend's order, I thought she must of been joking because, from my perspective, it seemed to be a small order for just breakfast. I tried to order more food off the menu, but she stopped me. Apparently the food portions are huge here. She was right. 

When the Girlfriend's french toast came, I was very surprised. It came on top of an oval plate with four large pieces of said french toast, but also generous portions of sunny side up egg, sausage, ham, and butter. My meal was even larger. It had two sunny side up eggs, large amounts of home fries, irish sausage, ham, more ham - or what I thought was ham- (God, I wish I had taken pictures), and buttered toast on the side - all for nine bucks! 

The meal was decent. One can't complain too much because the price is so low for what they give you ( Hey, at least the silverware looked polished). The sausage tasted weird, but maybe it's because I'm not used to the taste of 'Irish' meat. The server came around three times ( I believe he is the son of the proprietor ) and gave me more rounds of coffee. All in all, it was a good experience for me and I'd recommend anyone to drop by and have a meal at New Taraval Cafe.
author: Kimbo L.

description: Like everyone says CHEAP and it is delicious! Breakfast special before 10am = $3.50: two eggs, bacon/sausage, pancakes/toast. While it may be cheaper just a smidgen to do it at home, I don't have to cook, do dishes or make sure I have all the stuff. Love this place for breakfast before work :)
author: Vanessa K.

description: The food is very inexpensive but with large portions. The service is great and it's a quiet hidden spot that looks like only locals come to. Would definitely come back again.
author: Adam H.

description: Was a very busy Saturday morning so it took a while for the waitress at the counter to notice me sitting there but once she did I got the breakfast special and it came out fast! It was really good and cheaaaap! I could barely finish and I'm a big eater. With coffee tax and tip it was 10 bucks even. And that doesn't happen in SF too often! Highly recommend
author: Francisco O.

description: Best cheap breakfast in The Sunset. Great burgers. Fast service.No frills. Old school.
author: C U.

description: I've been here for a weekday breakfast a couple of times now. The staff is great. They are friendly and in good diner fashion they keep the coffee cup always full. The only reason they got a 4 instead of 5 star rating was a bit of a miss on the breakfast special. The eggs over easy were definitely underdone - the whites were a bit runny. Everything else about the place made up for that. I'll chalk up the eggs to a simple mistake this time. I'll be back again to give it another try.
author: Gerry M.

description: Skeptical about this breakfast spot but we got sat down right away. Noticed a good special for $3.50 until 10am! Didn't make it on time so we ordered the New Taraval Special which includes; two eggs with your choice of sausage, ham or bacon with potatoes and toast with your choice of coffee or tea for $6.75. Coffee was good. They give big portions and we were all satisfied with our order especially for that price. Our waitress was sassy but cute (yah, a huh). Give this place a try if you are looking for a quick, cheap breakfast.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
Cheap? Yes. Filling? Yes. Delicious? Oh yeah.

I was there with an awesomely dorky friend and his awesomely dorky sister and together we were awesome dorks.  We talked of terrifying dreams and me blurting out how I had a dream recently of lactating whales and how I drew a wall of cartoon versions of them before I woke up.  I tried to keep it down but they were just as confused as I was and asked questions.

This was all over $4 plates of breakfast of sausage, eggs, and toast that Denny's has nothing on.  I'm not entire sure how Denny's survives with their sub par food and service.  This place is truly a mom and pop joint that I am willing to do business with.
author: Ashley I.

description:
The inner Sunset has a bunch of greasy spoon type diners at 9th and Irving that vary in quality and personality.  Predictably, the Outer Sunset has fewer, and the neighborhoods they are situated in tend to lack the vibrant atmosphere of their eastern counterparts.

New Taraval Cafe is probably the best one I've encountered west of 19th ave.  The food is roughly on par with what you'd find at Art's on Irving Street, and the prices are around $8 per plate.  

My favorite item on their menu is the Italian sausage with eggs.  They serve it with either hash browns or chopped fruit, and I switch between them on a weekly basis.  

The 20th and Taraval corridor is not particularly handsome or inviting, but there are plenty of other businesses to peruse, should you get the urge to walk off that 10:00 am grease bomb you just ingested.  

The proprietors have a quirky sort of abrupt manner to them that is neither welcoming nor rude.  It's as though they've reconciled themselves to the fact that people aren't really in here for the pleasant atmosphere.  

A large framed picture of the Three Stooges playing golf adorns the wall behind the counter.  Think of it as sort of a spiritual manifesto for the place.
author: Gopal R.

description:
I've been here a few times mainly because my brother in-law loves the place because its cheap.  The prices here are cheap and the food it decent.   

Pros:  Cheap Prices and Okay food.

Cons:  
-Can't order fries because there is only one chef and he can't fry   fries   right now??

-I hate it when places recycle ketcup bottles over and over again where the plastic on the bottle looks foggy and the label is worn and sticky.  

-the final straw that made me never to come here again is the waitress Mary snatched a spoon out of my 2 y/o son's hands  because he was tapping it on the table.  Don't you dare snap at my kid.  You can tell me politely to take away the spoon but don't discipline him like he's your child. 

Mary...you're rude!!!
author: Patrick C.

description: This place is a hole-in-the-wall local hangout. Great prices, delicious food. Get the special. The bacon/avocado omelette was fluffy and delicious, perfectly cooked, better than most that I've ever had. You get generous portions for such a low cost! Service was friendly and attentive.
author: B L.

description: I have been ordering take out on my way to work. The food and service are very good. I had the Joe's special today which was very tasty and a whole bunch of hash browns which were very good but needed a little more seasoning. Would highly recommend this place for breakfast!!
author: Elaine L.

description: Simple as it gets. You sit, you order, your food pops out immediately.  And it's a freaking hot, warm, meal full of yummy eggs, toast, bacon, and french toast. What more is there to ask?
author: Austin R.

description: Love their breakfast special. Inexpensive and tasty! Very good customer service even though the place is usually packed.
author: John M.

description: Great price for decent food. Their morning special is only 3.50 if you order before 10am. Service is friendly and the wait was short.
author: Gilbert V.

description:
I had this place bookmarked for some time, and finally tried it yesterday before taking the MUNI Candlestick Park shuttle from 19th Ave to attend the 49ers game.

Indeed the workers are friendly.  It looks like a family-operated place.  The lady who served me was very diligent about coming by and refilling my coffee often.

I thought about ordering breakfast food since I haven't had such a meal in some time.  However, i was tempted to order their bacon avocado cheeseburger based on a review, sounded like something a little unique.  It was good but could have been juicier.  Maybe it's because I asked for it medium well.  I got to remember to ask for either medium or medium rare for burgers in the future.

Their operating hours are limited: 7am to 2pm.  I wouldn't mind coming back, especially if I can get myself to leave the house early for breakfast on an off day.
author: H K.

description: Great mom and pop place that is a hole in the wall.  Many times you will just pass by it without wanting to explore it, but that will be your downfall! Never judge a book by its cover. Excellent pancakes and omelettes. Very surprised by great early morning breakfast deal that is really cheap $5 for those really under a budget! :-) Their other items like the Irish Breakfast and just ordering a normal breakfast is just very tasty and flavorful. The hash browns are very unique and not made the way you think it is made. But it's very fulfilling! I was embarrassed when I had to ask for a doggie bag to bring home the hash browns! So this little spot is a dive and locals come here. The workers are very nice and fun to sit at the counter to see how they cook the food fresh in front of you. :-) So skip those greasy chains like Dennys and IHop and go for quality and the touch of human service that comes with a smile. :-)
author: Priscilla L.

description:
New Taraval Cafe makes me happy :)

This is my go-to breakfast spot in the city. 
Sure the place could use a little sprucing up - but that doesn't really matter.
What matters is the food is yummy, cheap, & quick.  

Mary & Tony (they run the spot) make the experience there even better! They're a friendly pair. Mary even has my order memorized! Then again, I do come here at least once a week.

I always order the typical: 2 eggs any style that comes w/ 2 pieces of toast & potatoes or fruit (the fruit is always in season & they don't charge extra for it). All this for only $3.75. Pay an extra $1.20 for a cup of coffee, which Mary will constantly refill.
You WILL get your caffeine fix.

The only downside - it's closed on Tuesdays.
author: Andrea R.

description:
This is by far one of the best breakfast/lunch cafes in all of the bay area!

The couple that runs the restaurant is by far the nicest couple you could ever meet! All of the food is cheap, great tasting and in extremely generous portions. Although the place is cash only, it is well worth it, and you probably won't need much cash. I would say $10 is enough for a great dish and a generous tip. 

I got the Irish Burger, and it is extremely tasty! The Irish ham with sauteed mushrooms and onions are great compliments to a gigantic burger. The fries are great tasting as well, but I opted to go with the potato salad, which is also great tasting, but in a GENEROUS portion. 

Come by for lunch or breakfast and leave impressed and fulfilled!
author: Langdon N.

description:
I live 100 feet up the street so I eat here a lot. Its a great place to go the morning after a long night. Tony  and Mary (the owners) are very sweet. The food is awesome, and the service is even more so. Mary will refill your coffee even before its halfway empty. Good vibes. 
Great deals as well. under $4 for full breakfast!
This place will be one thing I will miss about living on Taraval!
Only downside is it closes at 2pm and is closed Tuesdays.
author: Gray S.

description: Breakfast was right on time. Potatoes fresh off the grill. Prices  service good. Cash only.
author: Topher S.

description: Amazing food at a great price. Very short wait Monday morning to be seated. Breakfast for myself, my wife and younger sister. Easy to find street parking nearby. Ordered the Irish breakfast. Potatoes where so good we had to order an extra side.
author: Marvin E.

description:
This place is our favorite breakfast place. it's a the stereotypical american/irish breakfast joint run by the nicest chinese couple. We go there so much we just order the 'usual.' 
The couple is friendly 
the coffee is great
the food is hot!
and for two of us getting full plate breakfasts plus tip it's usually about $13. But we always give them a $20 because of the way they make us feel. 
We always arrive bitching about our weekly struggles, but leave this place happier. It never fails.
author: Rich V.

description: Almost a four star only because of the somewhat rundown atmosphere.  Family owned and run I believe.  Very friendly with fast service.  Typical American type breakfast for very cheap!  Healthy size serving, and hot of the grill.  Did I forget to mention cheap?!?  Would I go back?  Sure because I want to help local businesses, good cheap breakfast, and welcoming environment.
author: Joel M.

description:
I've been coming here for the longest time. The breakfast is pretty good and at a decent price. The atmosphere is pretty nice and the service is really good.
