I usually order the New Taraval Breakfast special which comes with 2 eggs, toast, meat (ham, sausage, bacon). They make really good pancakes and french toast. Other than breakfast, they have a pretty decent lunch menu with a variety of sandwiches and burgers. Their Club Sandwich is pretty big and tasty. Their cheeseburgers are very moist and has that great diner feel to it. Some times if i don't want fries with a burger or sandwich, i get mash potatoes or some fruit with no extra charge.

It's an awesome mom and pop restaurant. I've been going there ever since i was a child. The service is great and there's a great atmosphere. The food is great! Highly recommend =)
author: Vivian L.

description:
This is a review i shouldve wrote awhile ago, well me and my friend came here for a good breakfast because at tennesee grill they were extremely busy so we thought let's go here.
The only thing that ruined our meal was when my friend asked for wheat toast and the waitress i believe her name is mary.
So my friend asked for wheat toast and she kept saying rye over and over, ok i get it if u don't understand just please listen to your customers with patience.
The whole meal was good except for the misunderstanding between mary and my friend.
We also sensed that she was mad because we kept asking for extra items and when we got it she kinda just dropped it off at our table and making sounds to herself like she was muttering to herself.
When we paid our bill then she decided to be nice to us and we thought lady its too late to be nice, so my friend says never again, granted we know that you can have bad days, but her muttering words to us is un-called for.
The food is good but don't order the wheat toast unless you want her to  say rye over and over.
author: Corey W.

description:
I love ordering breakfast from this place and I have two favorite dishes that I rarely stray from.

Their Irish breakfast makes me feel like a kid on a Sunday morning, waiting for my father to cook up one of his famous Irish breakfasts. This dish has it all (except for the Irish soda bread). Two eggs, cooked any style, Irish bacon, sausages, both black and white pudding, home fried potatoes, and your choice of toast. Yeah, that's a LOT of food. This meal is not for the faint of heart (or those with heart conditions).

The other breakfast I like to order here is the BLT & egg on toast. You can't go wrong with a fried egg sandwich and this one really satisfies. Comes with NTC's signature home fried potatoes.

In addition to breakfasts, this cafe also offers a lunch selection. I wish I could tell you more about their lunch menu but, unfortunately I only order lunch from them on Thursdays. Now here is where we get to the part where those of you who have read this far into my review learn the secret of New Taraval Cafe. Lean in closer. Closer...

Every Thursday, this Mom & Pop operation roasts a whole turkey and then carves it up to make the best damn turkey club sandwich I have ever eaten. This is not an item on the menu. You have to hear about it word of mouth... and now you have. 

Make sure you get your club sandwich before noon. They only cook one turkey and those sandwiches go FAST. Order their potato salad on the side with that sandwich. It's the perfect accompaniment.

In closing, when I say Mom & Pop, I MEAN it. The couple who run this place ask me where I've been when I don't show up on a regular basis. It's a good feeling to know that your patronage is appreciated that much.
author: Rory O.

description: Great little diner that lived up to its rating. Mushroom burger was perfect. Service attentive. An ideal stop just off 19th Avenue.
author: Gary O.

description:
My husband and I went there this morning.  After reading previous reviews we decided to give it a try. Initially when we arrived my husband was very hesitant to eat there. It was small and it is CASH ONLY.
 
However, once we walked a few doors down to the ATM and went back, we were quickly seated and promptly given 2 glasses of water. The server was very friendly. Once we ordered, it took less than 5 minutes for our food to arrive at our table.

The food was hot, and fresh.  Not spectacular, but not bad by any means either.  We only paid $10.25 for both of us...not bad at all. 

All in all, we would definately go back.  I took one star away because it does need to be updated.
author: Michelle R.

description: A Gold Standard for a breakfast cafe  We live in Los Angeles and when we come to visit family in San Francisco we always eat breakfast here, have for years and will keep doing so. Mary and Tony run a great cafe. The Breakfast Special is the best deal in The City. It's a steady stream of regulars who often bring visitors here and make it a point to introduce them to Mary.
author: Michael K.

description: I saw this place a few times and thought I'd try it. The prices looked very reasonable and I was hella hungry.  I ordered the corned hash with eggs.  The staff was friendly enough and I was immediately tended to.  The dish came out within 10 minutes.  I asked for my eggs to be scrambled.  They were but slightly runny.  Yuk! Then I took a look at the corned hash.  It looked and tasted like it was fresh from a can! Man, I got jipped. So now you know. You might want to stick to something super simple like a sandwich.  Even the water was nasty. I don't usually complain but I took a little sip and it tasted as if it had some type of chemical in it. I literally didn't swallow the rest. I spit it right back into the cup.  Then I told the waitress she needed to check her water resource.  I won't be returning.
author: D M.

description:
I first went to New Taraval Cafe when I was in high school. I am now much older and still drop by when I can. I love this place. 

A true mom and pop shop run by hardworking decent people. Food is great especially on a cold foggy morning in the Sunset.

Burgers are excellent for lunch.

I prefer this place to the much more hyped Tennessee Grill a block away.
author: Mike L.

description:
I always thought this restaurant was closed. I feel they might need to improve their exterior to be more lively, but anyways.. this place is great!

When I seek restaurants, I look for great food, but when I'm joined by great service, I'm a happy camper.

The reviews don't lie, this place is a run by a lovely couple who are incredibly nice! I came in here around 10AM and wanted a burger! Haha, yeah I'm not into the whole eggs and sausage etc, when I can have myself a nice burger. Before New Taraval Cafe, I always had my fixing at Tennessee Grill, but now I've found myself a new joint. 

Portions size is huge, service is fast, I'll definitely be back to support their business again. Keep in mind Cash only!
author: Austin N.

description: A neighborhood haunt.  Great for a standard breakfast. Good food; good price and good service.  Really love this place but wear clothes you can change out of as you may smell like the grill when leaving  if you're seated too close to the kitchen.
author: Ngeean x.

description:
I really like this place.

First the prices are very reasonable and food is tasty.

I usually get the "breakfast special" priced under $4 and only served before 10:00.
choice of pancakes or potatoes, with 2 eggs and either bacon or sausage.

at lunch I have enjoyed the cheese burger and french fries.

Owner Mary and her son (now the cook) are very friendly and make you feel at home.  I feel like I know the family and really want them to succeed...

Interested in meeting local characters of the Taraval / Parkside neighborhood, this is the place as I see the same people here eating all the time.

Yes, things could be improved upon... and hopefully the economy will improve and bring more customers.

Try out the New Taraval Cafe...
author: Lori G.

description:
Word of caution: I write about man parts.  Didn't have to but, come on, it makes for an interesting story and review!

However, the dude that flung his unimpressive manhood in clear view of diners was absolutely disgusting.  Let's face it, man parts are just...ewwwww.  Sorry, fellas but I've heard many of you say the same thing about yourselves.  I also found it very alarming since the cafe is in a residential area.  You would think the crazies wouldn't be in that area.  Then again, they're everywhere, eh?  

Fortunately, I ate my meal (that I almost threw up), prior to the incident and was very satisfied.  I think a lot of it had to do with the fact that the meal was so gawd damn cheap.  I mean, this place serves up a hearty portion for their Black and White breakfast for dirt friggin' cheap!  I mean, you could get a breakfast for two for about $14 (including coffee and juice and/or tea)!  Fan-freakin'-tastic, I tell ya!

Hopefully, some idiot doesn't go flashin' his mornin' sausage when you decide to eat there.  Word of advice: Don't sit next to the window!  Gaaah!
author: Dorothy S.

description: Good pancakes, eggs, and potatoes. Great for anyone looking for cheap breakfast with good, quick service.
author: Jesse B.

description:
Came here for Christmas breakfast with my mom, so kudos for being open on a holiday.

Don't come here expecting to get some grand feast of eggs benedict and mimosas - this is a good, small joint with a very basic menu of hearty breakfast food. It's cheap, but not dingy or gross, and the lady serving us was super nice and attentive. Also, best glass of orange juice ever, not too sweet and acidic - served ICE cold. 

Awwww yeah.
author: Courtney S.

description: This was a great place to come in and get a quick breakfast.  Their menu is pretty basic (not artisanal) which sometimes is all you need and their prices reflect it.  The decor and booths are a bit dated, but In the end I just wanted a good meal at a good price and didn't really care about decor.  The staff was very friendly and social as well.  I would definitely come back.
author: Julie P.

description: Great place to have breakfast/brunch! My man and I come almost every weekend. Great service and yummy food for a great price. Breakfast special is my favorite and only four dollars before 10am. Come and eat at a delicious and yummy diner.
author: Veronica C.

description: a diamond in the rough if there ever is one. wow...my first visit there, i admittedly totally judged this place as dirty and grungy. perhaps it is, but damn the food, low price and fast service is quite remarkable. definitely one of those neighborhood-gem type of places. they serve breakfast food, burgers and sandwiches, but i highly recommend the corn-beef hash. you, yourself can go there, but don't freakin' tell anybody else about it...then it's going to be all crowded and crap, and all the newbies are going to make us wait for a table.
author: Mike C.

description: This is my go-to breakfast place. Its a hole in the wall but the breakfast is good and low priced. breakfast with potatoes and coffee for $7? SOLD! Only drawback is that they close at 2pm. Could go for breakfast later in the afternoon some days.
author: Armando R.

description: Delicious, inexpensive, and wonderfully cheerful service! Best Irish Breakfast and scrambled eggs I've had in this city!
author: Miguel V.

description:
From the looks of it outside I knew this wasnt gonna be a classy joint, or even have that "cafe" sort of vibe. This is a greasy spoon. The place looks kind of dingy. Me and my friend's silverware were 6 different designs from 6 different countries, which reminded me of my parents house. So it came as no surprise to me when I saw mom and sis taking orders and serving while dad and bro (maybe uncle too?) were cookin it up. I had the Irish Breakfast. Never had black and white pudding before. I have to say, it's pretty tasty, as were the sausages, and the irish bacon. Their hash browns seem more of a cross between mashed potatoes and home fries. Still crispy, but soft and mushy in between.

So what if the silverware is mismatched, and the furniture and decor are old and outdated. I like to support family owned businesses and its great to see the whole family working together. Low overhead and family-employees means they can keep their costs and their prices low. Great little local eatery. I was staying near the area, but had I been further I probably wouldn't have gone out of my way to come here.
author: Keith P.

description:
This just might be my new favorite breakfast spot in the city.  The food is pretty good and they are cheap and definitely worth it.  They have a Breakfast Special for $3.95.  Before 10am, it is $3.65.  It includes 2 eggs, 2 pancakes and 2 bacon or sausage.  Add home fries for about a buck more.  I was definitely stuffed at the end of my meal.  For the home fries, they give a very large portion and I'd recommend sharing.  Pancakes were very good and fluffy just the way I like them...    

Friendly service and refills on coffee keep coming.  Coffee is $1.20 but I would say that the coffee might be the only thing I would downgrade this place for.  It's cheap but it does not taste very good.  I would gladly pay a little more for thier coffee if they would improve it.  If they do that, this rating would certainly bump up to a 5 star...
author: Mark W.

description: My dad and I have been coming here since I was a little kid. The owners are great, the food is good. It's a no-frills neighborhood joint, and I absolutely love it. The Irish breakfast here is better than at the Irish-owned place down on 32nd and taraval.. that's saying something! And the avocado chicken burger is super good. The chicken noodle soup is awesome, too.
author: Melissa C.

description:
Always leave full!  I dream about the corn beef hash, eggs over easy with  
tons of potatoes.  If I could I'd eat there every day but I'd probably get a heart attack.  Love the old school greasy spoon hearty down to earth style of this place.
author: Sylvia K.

description:
The fam and I had a hankering for some good old classic American breakfast so after perusing the Yelp reviews, I decided to order takeout brunch from New Taraval Cafe.  I phoned in an order for:

-two $3.95 breakfast special with 2 hotcakes, eggs and sausage or bacon
-two corned beef hash with eggs
-one ham, egg, and sausage breakfast

The woman who took my order was ON IT. She repeated everything back to me, told me to come by in 10 minutes and my total super quickstyle. I got there about 15 min later and sent the hubby in to pick up the order as I waited, illegally parked (parking is difficult), in the car. He went in and immediately came back out with our orders.

The hotcakes were totally awesome - the perfect balance of fluffiness and denseness to soak up the syrup. My bacon was not overcooked (I hate overcooked bacon!) and tasted oh so yummy also drenched in syrup. The scrambled eggs were also done perfectly as they came on top of the hotcakes but did not run one bit. The other orders also looked great. I tried my hubby's corned beef hash and I wanted to eat his breakfast as well! The best part was that I ate up my entire breakfast, plus a half of a hotcake that my mom didn't eat and at the end, I didn't feel at all nasty, like I just ate at a IHOP or Denny's.

Terrific, fast service. Yummy American breakfast. Good-sized portions for the money. Overall, a great place to scratch that lazy Sunday afternoon itch for a coma-inducing brunch that will make you want to be lazy for the rest of the beautiful San Francisco day.
author: Dawn L.

description:
Took my daughter here for breakfast based on proximity and positive yelp reviews.  I didn't enjoy my breakfast. The eggs were slimy, the sausage was not very good, and the coffee was very untasty. My daughter's corn beef hash was good, though.

I might go back for the hash, but otherwise not.
author: Barbara V.

description:
This place has a funky smell and funky inner sunset people for realzzzzz. I knew this place would be A-OK because the price was very reasonable. I mean for 3.50 you can get two eggs, bacon, and hot cakes! The meal was meant to be eaten to get my day going and not for pleasure...

I RECOMMEND THIS IF YOU ARE ON A BUDGET AND WANT EGGS DAMMIT ! OH AND THEY CLOSE AT 2PM
author: Billy T.

description: Oh man. So good. French toast special. Endless coffee. Great service. Who needs cheddar anyways? Live close by, come get some new taraval.
author: Isaiah A.

description: I'm not sure if the melon was contaminated or because my scrambled eggs were watery, but I got food poisoning from this place and i've been trying to recover for a week now. The food is great n cheap, but I already told the owner that my egg was undercooked the last few times I was there. The cook did cook it thoroughly when I told them that and I thought they would fix that problem the next time I came back. I see he undercooks all eggs whether its an omelette or scrambled when I am waiting in line to be seated. There's definitely a safety concern when you undercook eggs, with a chance of getting salmonella or the stomach virus, like I did. Anwyays, I know the family works hard n the food does taste great. But I think I'm going to stay away from this place for awhile. Hadn't had a stomach ache for couple months prior to eating here and now my stomach is super sensitive and upset all the time. It's been a week now, and I'm still running to the bathroom every day I wake up and after every meal, which I have been eating pretty clean, and adding probiotics and yogurt on top of that.
author: Eric C.

description: Cute little neighborhood joint. Smells a bit oily but the food is a great homemade breakfast/brunch. The staff are very nice and pleasant. Perfect for a Saturday it Sunday brunch.
author: Mike Y.

description: The New Taraval Cafe is a terrific diner. I have passed by this place a million times walking up and down Taraval, but never went in. My brother and I decided one day to give it a shot and boy were we happy. The workers were very friendly, and attentive. I couldn't even finish my cup of coffee before she refilled it. I got the corned beef hash which was really good, and I know my corned beef hash. They give you a huge portion of hash browns and top it all off with a sunny side up egg. My brother got the avocado and bacon omelet, which he said was delicious. His breakfast was around $6 which is a very good price considering how expensive avocados are right now. The whole breakfast was under $15 which was a steal. I would recommend this place for people who love inexpensive, yummy food.
author: Eileen M.

description: I'm very lucky to have recently moved to a neighborhood that's within walking distance of this tiny diner. The decor is classic greasy spoon, the food is delicious, the staff is warm and friendly, and the price - a special with 2 eggs, bacon/ham/sausage, potatoes, toast, & beverage for $6.25? I though California was supposed to be expensive! I plan to become a regular!
author: Cheryl A.

description: Good food...amazingly low prices.  Def better than Denny's...somehow even cheaper.
author: Bryan K.

description:
This isa great mom and pops shops that you hear about every once in a while. Being a small family run business I always tend to go to places like these over the big chains. The place is relatively small compared to other places and can seat around 30 at most but it's a nice cozy atmosphere inside with a lot of regulars who come and go. The owners act as cook and waitress so it's really easy to get to know them after a few visits and they are super friendly as well. One thing I can say is that after coming here for years this is still the place to be.

The menu can be a little limited to those with big aspirations in wondering what to eat but the thing to get is the Breakfast Special. Comes with 2 eggs, 2 bacon or sausage, and toast with an addition charge if you want to add hash potatoes. It has a nice home cooked feeling to it and it's just simply amazing for under 4 bucks. Another thing to try is their bacon cheeseburger. I know, I know there are so many other places out there where you can get a burger but I like this place more having nice quality along with it.

If your feeling more adventurist then go for the hamburger steak with onions or mushrooms. That'll get you going for a great lunch. If that's not for you than the overwhelming Denver Omelet is ever so filling as well. If you want something good and inexpensive this is the place to go and it's so much better than Tennessee Grill down the block!
author: Jason Y.

description:
Dingy dive.  Has counter.  Has booths.  Has absolutely nothing but white paint turning yellow from years of bacon grease.  Boring diner menu, but it's a diner and if you ding them for that you have no idea why you are going there anyway.  

Nice staff.... always helpful and REALLY friendly.  

Food was so so for a breakfast diner.  

I am really trying to write shorter reviews.  I hope this qualifies..... cheers!
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: Been living about 3 blocks away from this place for 29 years and hadn't eaten here until probably 2 years ago. All I could think was... "damn! I've been missing out all these years!" It's practically unheard of nowadays to get good food for very cheap prices. My boyfriend likes to get their breakfast special which is $3.50 before 10 and $4 afterwards and I LOVE their french toast. They make it just like my mama's and anyone who can make french toast like my mom's wins a special spot in my heart. This place is ran by a family-- parents own it and the daughter/mother takes orders and serves while the two brothers and father do all the cooking. We usually come here for breakfast but occasionally lunch too-- my boyfriend liked their burger but we think their breakfast is better. They are a great family who knows how to take care of their customers. IIt's a cozy little spot where it's like Cheers and they do definitely know your name. And for all you college kids living in the Sunset, this place will serves a hearty breakfast that will def. help with your hangovers!
author: selina n.

description:
After a lacking experience at M's, we kept looking for a morning breakfast place to live up to our expectations. Sadly, this place, while better than M's, didn't meet them.

On the plus side, it's very cheap. If one is on a strict budget, but desires to eat out, New Taraval Cafe could fill that niche quite nicely. We expect a little more, though, and the slightly greasy food wasn't the most appealing to us. The menu itself is fairly standard, which isn't a bad thing when you want a cliched American breakfast (or Irish breakfast) as we did, but it doesn't lend the place to being very memorable.

Overall, we don't plan to come back here. If someone was local, we could see them stopping by for a quick fix of pancakes on the cheap, but with driving distance factored in we have little incentive to revisit the place.
author: Sami R.

description: I like this place because it's extremely cheap and the restaurant is damn clean. Even the ketchup lids are spotless. Workers are friendly and service is fast.
author: Al O.

description: THis place is lovely, the owners are sweethearts. The food is adequate for breakfast. I'm a super heavy critic for breakfast food, so you have to know that when considering my review. I will say I return here, and I'm not disappointed because I know what I'm getting. But, it's not high end breakfast food. It's good, comes quickly, served with a smile, and reminds me of a good diner breakfast while traveling in small towns in America. No frills.
author: Marian G.

description: I like mom and pop restaurants. They pay more attention to the customers and give good customer service. I had a pleasant breakfast here with my daughter Leila.. Good food at a great price. I ordered the Irish Breakfast and the portions were plentiful. Will be coming back to try the Corned beef hash....
author: alexander r.

description:
A Very Solid, Solid 4.25 stars! 

Walking past this place, you'd wonder.... hmmm... 
Is it a  .. 
Chinese takeout? 
Hong Kong Style Eatery, a la the D&A Cafe? 
Deli? 
Greasy Spoon? 
Restaurant Supply shop? 

The sign outside simply says "New Taraval Cafe" 

Back in the dot com era, I used to work on Townsend right around the corner from Susie's Cafe, which we would lovingly call: 
"Greasy Susie's", simply because it was seemingly located adjacent to a car garage. (cb, you know what i'm talking about!) 

http://www.yelp.com/biz/susies-cafe-san-francisco#hrid:jM7rhto3yawE7vd8bMZQEA/query:susie's%20grill

Though my dot com days have come and gone, I'm glad to say that  I've found my second Greasy Susie's. I guess it's Greasy Tony's. 

NTC is a "greasy but yummy spoon" that rivals the best of 'em. 
Their grilled ham & cheese ($6) is prepared with a luscious & generous slice... shall i say.... *cut* of ham (not those thin weenie deli slices) ALMOST a centimeter thick. 

Their sandwiches are served with your option of cole slaw, potato salad, fries, or 'fresh fruit'. 

Fresh Fruit? Yeah, I've heard that before. 'Fresh fruit bowl' at one popular breakfast place in Cow Hollow consisted of unripe melons and strawberries... so I was VERY, very weary but considering this option. 

So I asked... what fruits make up the side of fruit? 
She responded: "Watermelon, Banana, and Orange". 
OK, I thought, I'm game. 
(... Pshaw, as if I even need a 'side order' with my grilled ham and cheese, right? These pants barely fit as it is.) 

YUM, when the plate arrived, I was pleasantly surprised. The 'side order' of fruit was perfect.... Bananas ripe, Orange sweet, and even the Watermelon was seasonally in season. 

Open at 7AM, Closed at 2:30PM... 
Closed Tuesdays! 

Seriously, all this while I wondered where everyone in the 'hood was eating lunch. *HERE* they are! duh!
author: M'ia K.

description:
Was looking for  quick breakfast place to eat on our way down 19th  to the De Young museum this morning. Quickly searched on YELP, and all my padawans directed us to this little mom and pop shop. Now, i love going to MOm and POP places and this place was the bomb.com.
Mom worked the counter, dad worked the grill, and they both work the dishwashing area...too cool! this is hard work, but they probably save a ton of moolah on overhead. The breakfast special really is all that and a bag of Ewok cookies. for 4 bucks you can get two eggs, two fat hot cakes (or toast) and two good sausages or bacon. Be good to your heart and don't order bacon though. Friendly service, charming interior. Do NOT be put off by the outside..yeah, it looks like crap..but give it  a shot, and you will be happy. The large portions will satisfy the Jabba in you.
author: Jerry C.

description:
I found myself stuck at 26th Ave and Ortega because of the marathon.  And because of the marathon, I did not want to move my car because parking was a premium.  So I walked a couple miles to this place after finding it on yelp.  One look from the outside and I was ready to head for the hills, but I went against my instincts and took the plunge.  I saw a cop was in there, which helped me put my mind at ease because cops know where all the good food is.  I got two eggs, four sausage links, wheat toast, and hash browns for $6.  Food was typical diner quality food, no surprises there.  What did surprise me was when I asked for water, the guy opened a refrigerator from the 80s (one of those old white ones). He went to get ice from the ice tray and he used his bare hands!  He didn't wash his hands first either!  Then as I was moving my plate, I felt the bottom of the plate was extremely greasy.  It seemed clean enough on the top, but it made me wonder how well they actually clean their dishes.  Really nice staff, though.

After I finished my food, I saw the sign that said the day's special was three pieces of french toast, two eggs, and two sausage links or pieces of bacon for $6.  I wish I would have seen that first...I would have probably gotten that instead.

All in all, not a horrible place.  There's some health code concerns, but no more than any other diner.  I probably won't walk 30 blocks to come here again though.
author: A W.

description:
"Wanna go to that breakfast place we used to go to when we cut class in high school?"

That's how I ended up having a late breakfast with one of my friends. We walked into the small diner and senior year nostalgia took over me. As I looked at the menu I remembered why we came here so much during high school...everything is so affordable!

After being greeted by the hostess we were seated pretty fast into one of the booths. The hostess seemed a little bit disheveled because it was busy but she was still very nice. I immediately knew I wanted to the breakfast special : 2 pancakes or 2 toasts, 2 eggs, 2 pieces of bacon or sausage for less than 4 bucks. Everything came out really good, especially the pancakes! They were huge and so tasty! 

My friend got the sliced ham omlette. It was delicious--the only downside was that their was cheese in it when the menu didn't state that there would be cheese. My friend was not pleased but not mad. We enjoyed it and her order came with homemade potatoes....mmmm.

The restaurant itself isn't very pretty but you always get fast and friendly service there.
author: Jo Ann E.

description: Very cheap and good:) very friendly and nice. But its very small and old
author: Jun I.

description: Stanley knows how to make a mean kick ass burger.  Breakfast is bomb too.
author: Jay W.

description: I really like it here, because it's really calm and casual. The employees are friendly as well as the customer crowd. The food is hearty, filling and tastes good. It reminds me of homemade cooking. :)
author: Sara M.

description: Great prices, great omelette, and friendly service!  Definitely a hole in the wall, but the food and service make up for it.
author: Sophie G.

description: Oh How I love these guys! A breakfast for under $4 dollars and they just keep the coffee refills coming!
author: Mark B.

description: I popped in here early one morning after a long drive.  Its the crappy hole-in-the-wall restaurant that completely blows your mind with awesome food, lots of it, extremely friendly staff there to serve you and prices that were, in my opinion for the quality and quantity, FAR too low.  If I ever find myself through Taraval again I'll definitely have to stop by this place.  I left VERY happy.
author: Daniel K.

description:
I am SHOCKED at the number of good reviews at this place that I literally had to check if I got the name right. But I did... I came in for breakfast and I was disgusted at the sticky tables they sat us in, and the horrible customer service. Asking if we could switch to a booth maybe, they said "no" and walked away. No explanation. Nothing. We were sat all the way in the back of the restaurant, by the restroom which was unpleasant, and there were dirty buckets on the ground around us. Gross. Not only that but there are huge horse flies flying around us in the back of the restaurant. That is never a good sign. Huge flies like that mean they are feeding off rotting SOMETHING, which I don't even want to know what. The waitress comes to ask us if we want something to drink, and she sees the flies and has the nerve to say to us, "OH YOU BROUGHT FLY IN." No bitch, we didn't bring horse flies in with us. I wish the health inspector was here.

So trying to be optimistic, I think, "okay the menu is cheap so thats good." I decided to order an omelette with sausage and avocado. Simple enough right? Last time I checked... an omelette always has cheese. Thats what makes it an omelette and not just scrambled eggs right? Wrong. I had to ask for cheese. And I had to pay extra for it. Oooookay? They better at least know what theyre doing. 

Waiting... waiting... waiting... one persons order comes out... waiting... waiting... another order comes out... waiting some more... "HEY! Wheres my order? My friends are halfway through theirs!" I notice them stop eating and open their omelettes. Raw egg. Really? Oh and the cheese was one slice of kraft singles. Really not looking forward to my plate coming now... As my plate comes, my friends complain that their egg is raw. She flips it open with her HANDS, and says to us, "NO ITS NOT." What the fuck? Don't argue with the customers, especially when its blatantly raw and translucent.  I open mine as they are telling her the problem, mine is raw as well. And the slice of kraft singles is sitting there, unmelted. Wow. She didn't even take them back. 

We all look at each other like, "are you kidding me?" We try the hashbrowns. Which need salt. And ketchup. We open the ketchup... the color looks weird. Wait, why is it watery? 

Yes, every condiment was even watered down to the point where ketchup had the consistancy of tabasco sauce. 

I have never wanted to walk out of a restaurant more without paying. And then after I did pay, without a tip... I felt stupid as soon as I got outside. Why did I even pay for that? Disgusting. Should have got up and left, and gone straight to Tenessee Grill.
author: Jacklyn S.

description:
The Irish Burger at New Taraval is hands-down the best damn burger in town. Forget the crappy service and second-rate burgers at highly-touted places like Barneys, because the Irish burger just cannot be beat. What makes this the most delicious burger in town is a handmade, well- seasoned beef patty and perfectly cooked sauteed mushrooms and onions. The mushrooms and onions are perfectly al dente, and they never fry them into a black, soggy oblivion like most burger joints do. It does not hurt that they may be cooked in a butter and crack-cocaine sauce either, but seeing mushrooms on a burger that have not been totally murdered is new and refreshing indeed. All this is topped off with a couple of slices of tender Irish bacon (a.k.a. ham) and white American cheese. The fries are hearty and perfectly cooked too. 

If you are not in the mood for a burger, the breakfast has a lot going for it too. From the everything-under-the-sun Irish breakfast to simple eggs and home fries, New Taraval knows how to put together a simple and delicious breakfast with no thrills or B.S. After living in the Mission for two years, I have really come to appreciate the hipster-free environment at NT, and being served by the older couple that own the joint beats the hell outta having slop thrown at you by the dirty, hungover a-hole "servers"  at St. Francis Fountain or any of the Mission's sorry ass excuses for diners. It is worth the drive every time. Greasy spoon? Check. Friendly, fast service? Check. Real home-cooked food? Check. Douchenozzle-hipster-free environment? Check. No matter what neighborhood you live in, this joint is worth the trip. Without the Irish burger, your life will be incomplete.
author: Owen R.

description: Cheap - like, really, delicious, good hash browns, very friendly service.  The perfect brunch for your not-so-perfect Sunday morning/afternoon.
author: Ashley S.

description: I decided to come here since it was the closest traditional breakfast joint to SF State. From the outside, you'd never know what you were missing. It looks pretty janky, but the food makes up for it: irish meats, perfect scrambled eggs, and potato hash that makes you want to live in their kitchen. They don't accept credit cards, but there are four different banks less than a block away. AND you should only have to pull out one twenty. Great food, great price, happy people.
author: Kelly C.

description: Service was good and fast.   Food was just ok...nothing 2 write home about.  Tasted: Spinach & cheese omelet, country fries potatoes, and french toast. Really cheap.
author: Sharmila S.

description:
my buddy brought me here and introduced me as his wife. the lady, i think, part owner, was delighted. ha ha. anyway, he kept telling me about this place, the best irish breakfast in sf and the restaurant is owned and ran by a chinese couple... and he was right. well, i really never had an irish breakfast before, but it was yum. 

two eggs, toast, 2 sausages, irish bacon, blood sausages and potatoes made fresh and comes freakin' hot to your table.

cute atmosphere. hole-n-the-wall swarmed by the mixed locals. pay at the front

thumbs up: irish breakfast, fast, friendly service
thumbs down: the special of the day sold out FAST. no more turkey sandwiches after the chinese family behind us bought all the turkey and when the lady showed them the goods, they all went, "waaaaaaaah!" in delight.
author: Lauren Y.

description:
Back in high school years and years ago, my truant friends and I would come here everyday for brunch - six of us jammed into a Prelude meant for two. For no more than $4, you could get a big to-go order of eggs your way, bacon or sausage, home fries, toast, and pancakes topped with greasy goodness! 

We would then bring it back to math class and enjoy it while our retired MMA fighter teacher told us about his glory days.
author: Tony L.

description:
i seriously was siked when i heard about this place. cheap prices, but didn't know much besides breakfast and lunch. the bf was like 'this place?' and as i dragged him in, only one old man sitting at the counter and a little old woman at a table. he said it kinda smelled like a hospital. and that they could use a fresh coat of paint on the walls. that was his only complaint. BREAKFAST was fantastic, cheap, delicious, solid, and comforting. $3.95 for my sunny side up eggs, sausage and fluffy hotcakes! YUM! $1.50ish for the side of hash brown potatoes, huge amount. he loved his corned beef hash and over easy eggs. 
like everyone says- mom and pop place. she's friendly and quick to take your order and the chef is always smiling when you enter and when you leave thanking him so much for the meal. the prices are so good that we are definitely coming back when the craving hits.
author: Abigail W.

description: I enjoy going to New Taraval because they serve up good-sized portions of All-American breakfast meals for no more than $7 a plate. There is nothing special about this place, but I do enjoy the cheap breakfast meals. I took off a few stars because the owner always seems to be in a rush and expects you to immediately order upon being seated. I have now gotten in the habit of saying I do not need a menu. They do have some of the best corned beef and hash though! Also be aware that they are closed Tuesdays and are only open until 2pm on the rest of the days.
author: Surge C.

description: I am so sad that I moved out of San Francisco because I miss this place so much. I used to live up Taraval and would visit this place almost weekly. Their pancakes are so delicious. Their corn beef is drool worthy. Their toast, although seemingly simple, for some reason is very memorable to me. They give you HUUUUUUGEEEEE portions at very good prices. Expect to leave with your pants unbuttoned. I am very impressed how quickly the food comes out with just one cook. New Taraval Cafe, how I miss you so...
author: Eila S.

description:
Your typical mom-and-pop greasy diner.  Only open for breakfast and lunch.  The prices are unbelievably low.  Their breakfast special is less than $4!

Their omelets are awesome and jam packed with ingredients.  Speak Chinese to the lady and she will hook you up with tea instead of the typical iced water.

Be ready to order when you sit down.  Homegirl is quick.
author: Jenny L.

description:
One morning, I thought to myself that I'll try something different, something that is outside of my comfort zone. And I did so by dining by myself for breakfast at a place that was thought in my mind as a failing business. I've walked by New Taraval Cafe dozens and countless times. Most of which are met with the "Closed" sign faced me. Of course, being a little corner store that looks ancient, I didn't bother to check it out or give it a shot. Or at least, until recently.

Don't judge a restaurant by its worn-out exterior walls... Walking into the little diner, I was immediately greeted by the diner's staff: the cook and the host. Didn't see anyone else around besides the patrons already there, so I figure (from other reviews as well) that it is a Mom-and-Pop place. Counter sittings, booths for two for four and a table in the back for more than the booths can hold, this little diner didn't seem too small after all.

Looking though the menu was easy when I saw $3.95 breakfast combo, which consist of two eggs, two slices of toast or hotcakes, and two slices of bacon or sausage links. And I believe that it's slightly more expensive after 10ish. A note about the coffee though; it was a little weak, but the cup is never empty thanks to the constant refills!

Anyway, didn't take too long before my breakfast came. The hotcakes pretty much took up half the plate and my over-easy eggs had to rest its egg whites on one side of the hotcakes. For the price, the quality is impressive. 

The eggs were...like any other eggs, but the interesting thing is that most other breakfast places that does over-easy tend to leave the yolk with a thin layer. This set of eggs had the look of a fully cook egg, but when I got to the yolk, it was over-easy. Another plus, the fork I used didn't puncture the yolk. Of course, I'll say more about it if there was consistency after every order. 

The hotcakes weren't super fluffy, but they weren't under cooked either. Quite enjoyable to the last bite. 

Sausages...well, it's sausages. 

Good thing about this place that I learned to appreciate is the Mom-and-Pop feel of it. The thought that when folks come in for a meal and the staff remember your name is a dying culture all thanks to chain restaurants. Even so, I'm sure you'll be fairly delighted to dine here when you can't argue with the price and quality.
author: Jeremy L.

description: The place where everybody knows your name. Great breakfast. Kind people. Quick service. A real throwback.
author: Troy B.

description: I've been here several times and the food is very good and priced fairly. The service is efficient and attentive. I would give it 5 stars if the decor was nicer - it is worn and in need of refreshing. But the breakfast here is awesome.
author: Jayson H.

description: Tiny little place with great food and great service! My new favorite diner.
author: Patrick S.

description:
This mom-n-pop, shotgun shack, greasy-spoon breakfast spot was shared with me by locals when I moved to the city, and I take my less-bougey guests here for an eye-opener, particularly after a long night of drinking. It's a morning and mid-day only place.  

It's run by Mary and Tony, a husband and wife team, with the grill right by the front door, and traditional 5 seat bar with shakey stools. Tony blasts egg and pancake and potato orders out super fast, and while we haven't ever tried the full black and white irish breakfast because we're just not that brave, we're always happy with the super cheap breakfast special when we can drag ourselves in before 10am. It's something crazy like 2 egg, 2 pancakes, sausage, bacon, toast and coffee for $3.95. Everything is reasonably priced. I've never been able to finish what I order, even with giving away my pork products to tablemates. 

The soft, fluffy and not-chewy pancakes could do with some real maple syrup, but it tastes like diner pancakes with the basic maple flavored variety. The home fries are really tasty and could be a meal on their own. At Magnolia Cafe in Austin, they are. My eggs are always cooked to order, just right - over medium. The coffee is diner coffee. Nothing fancy here. 

The service is usually super fast, if a little nonchalant. Mary keeps coffee cups full and brings refills on OJ. There is a big table at the back for large groups, but mostly best for parties that fit into a booth.
author: Char Z.

description:
Mary and Tony ! Owners and great folks. Food is always fast ,fulling and tasty. My favorite is the Turkey  Ummm the skin is the best. Meat is juicy even the white meat.  Fries to go please with gravy. AHHHH 

My Favorite spot for a great breakfast/lunch.
author: Leonard E.

description:
Small and to-the-point.  

The owner/waitress is like a drill seargent.  We were waiting for the remainder of our breakfast party and she asked us to order three times.  She topped off the coffee every other sip.  I do enjoy the occasional coffee replenishment but for God's sake gimme chance to make a dent in the stuff before you throw off the cream and sugar balance.  

The food: Little variety from this greasy spoon.  The food was OK.  For a basic and OK 2-egg breakfast I'd pay 5 bucks max.  This one was $6-something.  Not worth it, especially since the "fruit" was apples and an orange wedge.  Seriously, cut up a damned canataloupe you bloody savages.
author: Eric S.

description:
(2.5 Stars)  Really Cheap, huge portions, really greasy.  This is a great place to take those friends to breakfast who think the quality of the restaurant is based upon the quantity that is served to you, not on how it actually tastes.

That said, can't beat it for cheap breakfast.
author: Kapeli M.

description:
If you are a cheapo musician like me, you treasure places like this. Breakfast, no nonsense basic eggs and potatoes with toast, juice, without emptying your wallet. Yeah, the counter stools are falling off, but the waitress is really on it so you don't have to stay long. I'd stay away from the coffee.
Mainly locals.
Bummer- they close early(2pm!!)
Play Golf with Your Friends.
author: Mag N.

description:
I've been coming to this place since I first started high school. This is the quintessential local mom and pop diner. Although the couple that are running it are Chinese the food is as American as apple pie. They've been in my neighborhood for longer than I can remember and they're still running strong.

I used to come here Saturday mornings with my buddies and order a New York steak with two eggs and iced tea, that was the perfect way to start off the day. My manager orders breakfast from here at least three times a week. For less than $4 you get two hotcakes drowning in maple syrup, two eggs, and two pieces of bacon or sausage, They've got tons of burgers on the menu, but my favorite is the Irish chicken burger. This a big thick piece of grilled chicken breast with big slices of American cheese and sauteed mushrooms.....*drool*

In about 40 years I'll be just like one of those old timers that walk in every morning and Mary's already got my usual order down before I plant my butt at a table.
author: Felix T.

description: I came here for some hungover breakfast and the food was really good and really cheap. I would NEVER have gone in here if a friend of mine didn't take me there. Good portions and you can watch the guy cook your food for you like a cheap version of benihanas. Lost a star because the orange juice was awful.
author: Jeremy P.

description:
The atmosphere is not what I think until I enter New Taraval Cafe.  

An old (at least not young at all) Chinese couple running Irish breakfast, sort of moms and pops diners place, slow service, and unfresh food.... This place beat my thoughts few years ago. Then I came here for a nice brunch when I got a chance.

I crave for more wide selections of breakfast while my honey always stick to the breakfast special.  I love the omelet, the one with cheese & ham, and there is another one with avocado, DELICIOUS!!!

The lady server is just like a mom placing a big-yummy-plates in front of you when you are still unconscious from waking up at 11am.  

I have taken as many of my friends and kins to this place as possible. and  would recommend to anyone! unless who wake up at 3pm!
author: Woodspy T.

description: Good service, decent food, great breakfast deal. Bring your friends.
author: Thomas C.

description:
The perfect find during a hungover morning when all I needed in life was to eat a proper breakfast. 

I loved every part of my Monterey omelette, even the fact that the cheese they use are Kraft singles. 

Fresh veggies, attentive service and low prices mean I will be returning.
author: Jessica M.

description: Small but personable.  Big breakfast.  Had the bacon and avocado omelette and was shocked at the amount of potatoes.  They call them home fries, but really sort of a cross between hash browns and home fries.  No decaf for my wife, but otherwise, everything was great.  She had the corned beef hash and eggs.  Fast and reasonable - $16 for two people.
author: Glenn L.

description: Their breakfasts are YUM-MMIEE! Staff is SUPER SUPER friendly and so are the customers inside. My experience there was great, had a good chat with the waitress and customers inside, just felt like a little community inside. Very homey feeling and prices are defiantly reasonable for a family owned business. I like supporting these kinds of restaurants rather than places like IHop where service is terrible.
author: irene l.

description:
It's traditional, it's basic, but it's oh-so-good, cheap, and super-friendly. Since I lived one block away I had the good fortune of enjoying this great breakfast cafe on numerous occasions. Highly recommended are the pancakes, french toast, hash browns, and endless cups of coffee... 

Parking: Not so great in direct proximity, but ample parking towards the Taraval park 1.5 blocks up the hill.

Groups: Since it's all booths and one small counter, 4 is probably the upper-limit for the average citizen.
author: Lorem I.

description: 3 words...Cheap, Fast, GOOD!!!! I've been eating at this place for over 10 years, ever since high school and I'm still loving it.  You can't get better than $3.95 for a big hearty breakfast special can you.  Their other breakfast plates can range to at most $7 each I think.  Corn beef hash & 2 eggs is one of my favorites there.  If you want a good burger, I highly recommend you try the Mushroom Chicken Burger, talk about DROOL!!! You won't be disappointed with this place, best breakfast & lunch joint in the Sunset.  They only have 1 cook, but man is he fast! They close early, so make sure to get in before 2pm.
author: Peggy C.

description: went here for breakfast, pretty quick order, good waiter service and friendly. moderately priced and comfortable seating. a great place to eat after a long hangover. very small and cozy dive.
author: Alex C.

description:
$3.95 for a breakfast combo.
2 eggs,
choice of 2 pieces of bacon or sausage
choice of 2 pieces of toast or pancakes!

Really?  That is a recession smart breakfast.  

Little dinner, mom n pop type place.  Little worn down, but clean and neat and maintained pretty well.

Service is always really good and consistent and everyone is friendly.
And again, for that price for breakfast, who cares!?
author: Denise B.

description: I have been going to this cafe for nearly 20 years.  Good food, great service and really great prices.  Eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, corn beef hash or sometimes the best clubhouse sandwich in San Francisco.  A great place to eat.  Not a place to see or be seen.
author: Edward S.

description:
I have ate at this diner for years and never had a bad meal. The breakfast special is one of the best deals any where in the city.
So many so-called diners only offer your typical out-of-the-box hashbrowns, which are usually horrible. The New Taraval offers either fresh home fried potatoes or steam rice with your breakfast order.
If you don't tell Mary that you only want one scoop of rice ( actually two scoops) she will give you two or three with your order. They are not cheap when it comes to portions.
Service has always been good along with a friendly attidude. She greats everyone with a big" Good Morning" as you walk through the door.There are many regulars who eat there on a daily basis.They are from all ethnic backgrounds and walks of life. Young and old alike I have never seen an unhappy customer.
They prepare a roast turkey that is wonderful.Again the portions are big and the food is fresh. I have tried most items on the menu  and found nothing which I did not like.
Anyone who I have ever taken there has truly enjoyed their meal. The also ask me how long has this place been there for. They never knew about this diamond in the rough.
Weekends can be very busy,especially after 9:00 am.They open at 6:30 am, at least for us regulars, but close by 2:00pm. Tuesday they are closed.Be prepared to place your order in a timely manner or Mary might just give you that look! I hope you enjoy it as much as we have over the years. CASH ONLY sign next to the poster of the Three Stooges. Go figure?
author: Scott Q.

description: very good little hole-in-the-wall locals spot. get the special.
author: Brittany M.

description: I came here once, because whenever I pass by they are always closed. Service was okay, food was acceptable.
author: Amy C.

description: This is best greasy spoon I've been to in the city. Don't waste your time going down the street to Tenessee Grill. Bacon is always crispy, portions huge, service crisp. The place is small and the ambiance is sun-faded and a little run-down but it's a great place to hide away with a friend for a while and read the paper over coffee.
author: Rosana M.

description: great place for home cook breakfast when you're feeling lazy in the morning.   Mary is great, she remembers what you like.
author: Shanny Q.

description: Great little coffee shop/diner run by a wonderfully friendly family.  Super cheap too, had to do a double take the first time I saw the bill....should have been twice as much.
author: Erick M.

description: No other breakfast joint compares to the joy that awaits me each time at NTC! Cheap and greasy, just the way I like it. After a few visits, Mary will know you and your preferences, and you'll feel right at home.
author: Michelle C.

description: Love this place!  Great food, nice whole in a wall, friendly family-run service.  Irish burger is amazing.  I make it a point to come in every week.  Out of all the glitzy trendy places to eat in the city, I love coming here the most.
author: Bessie C.

description: Great little neighborhood breakfast joint. Nothing fancy but lots of that good ol' community charm. Place was packed by the time we got our food around 10am. The best part about this place is the value. Great portions for little money and on top of that the food was good. The Breakfast Special was $3.65 (before 10am) and 3.95 thereafter, came with two large pancakes, 2 slices bacon and 2 eggs. The bacon wasn't the thin burnt kind either, it was thick and very tasty. We also ordered the bacon and avocado omelet, which came with a huge portion of hashbrowns on the side for $6.95. One note, if you have a small child bring your own highchair as they don't have any.
author: Brendon M.

description: I love this hole in the wall!  My old roommates (back in the college days of the mid 90s) always came here on Sunday after a night of partying for a good meal.  I never went at first but then I missed out. The couple who run this place are so nice, and there are soo many regulars who come into this place and they know them either by name or face.... i was impressed. Portions are HUGE, and the prices have barely gone up since back when I first discovered this place.  Yeah its no frills, the benches are taped up and springs broken and your booth is sunken in, but soo what? the food is good and you'll be full most definitely, whether you are ordering breakfast or lunch...they give you an obscene amount of fries if you're getting  a burger.... ahh the good ol days....I miss living in the City  and I miss the great dives like this.. sigh...
author: Lynette K.

description: Great place to grab a cheap breakfast. I believe this is one of the cheapest places I've seen in the Sunset to get breakfast at. I used to cut high school to come here for a hearty breakfast. I know, I'm terrible...
author: Andrew W.

description: Tried this place multiple times and never been let down.  The Italian sausage plate is great.  I don't know how, but the mash potatos are always perfect; just a bit mushy and a bit crunchy.   There is always a crowd, but as of recent the owners' have closed shop often.  Might want to give them a ring first before dropping by.
author: David P.

description:
Taraval cafe is... umm, well... Taraval Cafe.

When you walk up to the door, you wonder whether you are walking into a massage parlor or a diner, since the window has some sort of tint covering and the exterior decor is non-existent. They have a long counter in front of the grill and a few booths on the side.

We were seated at a booth and were by far the youngest people there (by a good 40 years or so). This place caters mostly to "regulars" since it seemed like the waitress/owner knew everyone's order. I ordered the breakfast special for $3.95. It contains two eggs, two slices of bacon/sausages, and two hotcakes. I also ordered the much-ballyhooed home fries ($1.50) and a cup of OJ. The OJ came quickly and was obviously from a carton, but I expected that. The order came soon after. The eggs were nice and runny, the bacon was pretty thick, and the hotcakes looked appetizing. You get what you order. Don't expect them to add anything special to their hotcakes or have any special cuts of bacon. The home fries came on a separate plate. They were nice and warm, but I would have preferred it to have more time on the grill to give it more than the smashed potato texture that was part of every bite. There were slices of onion running through the home fries and didn't contribute much to the overall flavor of it.

You basically get what you ask for. When the menu says eggs, hotcakes, and bacon, you are going to get eggs, hotcakes, and bacon. If you need a cheap, reliable breakfast, this is your place. If you are looking for something more gourmet, this is not it.
author: Gary L.

description: Great eats at great low prices. Freshly grilled burgers for 2 dollars each! Great homey decor.
author: Keit K.

description: If you get their omelettes, they come with two slices of bread and potatoes. They're huge. Really filling. Almost barfed when I finish it. The burgers are also pretty good, but prefer Tennessee Grill's over theirs.
author: Katherine C.

description: I try to go at least once a week. mom and pops place and they do it right. all tho what appears to be the worst thing you can do to a burger(press on it) these turn out GREAT. 5$ for a burger and fries. Ohh the fries are good too they use the wavy fries that are always good. The one thing that is also unique here is the ketchup it tastes different but good. only con is the lady wont ever give me a fork to go with my fries but thats not stopping me.
author: T L.

description: Oh, Tony, God of the Grill, how I long to feel the embrace of your Popeye arms. Best Irish breakfast in San Francisco -- whodathunk? The Phoenix and The Liberties used to serve the best, but they've both gone down hill, while Tony just keeps on truckin. Fried potatoes just like my mam used to make. I moved far out of the neighborhood and didn't go back for 2 years -- and Mary still remembered my usual. Coffee is bad though. Pick up a cup at the French Bakery kitty corner across the intersection and Mary won't even bat an eye. What a gal.
author: Laura R.

description: great diner. coffee refills free with food. the service was excellent. the food portions are huge and the food is cheep. totally amazing. i rate 4 stars instead of 5 because the only tea they have is lipton which really sucks. but the food is delicious diner food. this will be my go-to place when its time for going out to breakfast. the potatoes are greasy and amazing. (kinda like hashbrowns). they have omlettes and eggs and toast, steaks and burgers of all kinds. totally delicious. check it out, especially if you are hung over.
author: liz w.

description: The food is inexpensive and good depending on what you order. I usually get a burger and my friend usually gets an omelette. the portions are good and it's about $6 or $7 per entree. Sometimes the service isn't so great but the food is worth coming for
author: huy P.

description: It's very easy for a meal for two here to be about $15. The food ranges from average to good. The bad: the orange juice is from concentrate. And they seem to use lots of oil. As I was leaving, I saw the cook sautéing some onions on the griddle. I was a little shocked when I saw him scoop two ladlefuls of oil over them.
author: Crystal L.

description: looks pretty hole in the wall-ish. they only open for breakfast/lunch time and thats it but their breakfast is not bad. I had the irish breakfast? and it was quite satisfying. nothing extraordinary, lacking a wow factor, but i could possibly see myself returning for another meal. waitress was nice, so i'll add another star.
author: Jimmy N.

description: this mainstay for at least fifteen years makes it so not new, this husband and wife team runs this coffee shop, hard working and friendly ... oh the food, standard diner fare, keeping it simple for most of us ... counter seating and booths for a more communal dinning; thank you for your hard work at feeding the masses that inhabit parkside
author: tim y.

description: i prefer this place over tennessee grill just a block away. i love their patty melts and their french fries. their home fries are good too. wouldn't come here if youre in a rush though. there's usually only one cook and one waitress. and there's a limited amount of tables. typical greasy spoon, that's why i love it.
author: Douglas F.

description: This place is cheap and has really good food.  Their food service is rather fast although sometimes if it is crowded you get stuck at the back tables which have no room.  The workers are friendly although be ready to order quickly once you get in the restaurant.
author: Frank V.

description: i am never coming back here again because this place gives you the worst customer services. i came here twice with my boyfriend for breakfast, first time it was alright the second time we came back for breakfast, the lady gave us so much altitudes and act so fake. my boyfriend ordered sausage (on the side) instead of bacon and she gave us bacon and said we ordered it and have to keep it, blah blah blah. so we're like okay fine we keep it, it's still food so why not. then she walked around our table and start staring at us and giving us the face. wtf. she also have a hearing problem, because we repeated ourselves more than twice and she still can't even get the order right. then she repeats the order very loudly. she made everyone stare at us, like we can't order right.  the tables, knifes, spoons, folks, and plates have stains and sticky stuff on them. gross! this place is cheaper than a lot of places, but too bad i am not coming back ever again! no tips. good bye.
author: Valerie N.
